title: Platonic to start!
text:
Friends first; lets get to know each other!!

I am looking to make new friends. Any good relationship starts out as friends first and in due time can evolve into a meaningful relationship. Someone who just wants to have a good time without pressure, be yourself and I will do the same. Personally I am an easy going, laid back can be funny as hell, very sarcastic and like to laugh rarely get stressed or become angry. I will make fun of you as well of myself. Life is short so I just like to enjoy the days as they go by. I will at times do random acts of kindness to others just to make myself feel better and to make our world a better place for all. As to what I like to do the laundry list can go on and on, but will try almost anything once. Some of the things I enjoy most are trying new restaurants (ethnic ones with a green B in the window) road trips speeding to our destination, the outdoors and cooking and yes I am a good cook. Quiet moments together just enjoying the company of one and other; lets not forget acting our shoe size not our age.

One thing that is very important to me is that you are an honest and real, a kind and caring person who speaks the truth. Someone who has feelings and is not afraid to express then, help each other out in both times of good and bad.I don't care what you do fore work or where you live or what you drive, just be a good hearted and a real person that hard to find this city we call home. Ideally I am looking for someone who is a least 35.

What I would like to get out of this post, is to make some new friends and maybe just maybe a best friend and a lover. Someone to grow old and grey and tooth-less with and have medacare buy us a pare of Hoverrounds.


If you have read everything I have written great. Because there is so much spam or BS on these listings I will only reply back if you answer a few basic questions in no particular order.

Where do you live, a zip code will work. Just want to make shore were both in the same time zone?

What decade where you born in?

Should I be a monkey suite or jeans and tee shirt person?

Are you just as happy eating at an ethnic restaurant with a green B in the window as you might be at a fine dining restaurant?

In all fairness hear are my answers to my questions.

Nine oo three 5

Turbulent 60's

Jeans and tee

Green B ethnic

title: Looking for a friend to chat with and maybe more
text:
Life is too short to waste it, so finding a friend is my goal, to share special moments and conversations, which may become endearing, captivating, adventurous and downright fun.
I want something deeper than just superficial intimacy. I want to connect on a level so few have had the privilege to achieve with that special friend. Finding someone to chat and share everyday things, talking about our life's journey and all the choices we've made good or bad. 
I don't know why certain people are placed in front of your path, coincidences, fate or sheer happenstance but nevertheless, everyone I have come into contact with have been cherished and beloved memories. Are you the one this post was meant for, I sure hope you are, I know you're out there? Age to me is just a number to me, I hope it holds no real significance for you either. I am able to relate to you whether your 21 or 55, having the confidence in my ability to engage in great conversations with you.
I dare you to find out if I'm what is needed, to help get you through a boring day. Remember we all need someone in our life's from time to time to make us feel alive.

title: Opening your heart ...
text:
How about an encouraging and uplifting conversation ... platonic, even sister/brother-like? Nothing nude (except maybe we bare our souls), and nothing inappropriate. Not expecting to meet in person, but yes to a meeting of minds and hearts.

If you genuinely want to talk about the important things in life - love, relationships, parenting, careers, faith, and others ... all those good things that make life worth living - then we should get along very well.

Maybe also talk about the joys or challenges we face -- in marriage or just life; how we are being stretched, possibly overwhelmed, how we have overcome, or how we are being overtaken ... with grief, with fear, with loss.

title: Human contact / cuddling
text:
This may sound like a very strange request, but I'm looking for a fit / attractive person who wants to cuddle, or hang out together in close proximity. 

Watch a movie, have a couple drinks, conversation (or no talking) and just relax. No expectations no pressure. Nothing sexual at all - really. I just miss human contact without it being in any way about sex. 

I'm settling back into LA after a couple years overseas. I work long hours with a very demanding job, and I don't have much of a social circle - and don't feel comfortable turning to a friend for this.

title: Your Personal Shopping Buddy - A Man's Point of View
text:
Do you love shopping? Do you wish you had someone along on your shopping excursions for an honest and discerning opinion? You know quite well that a shop keeper and store clerk tell you what you want to hear in order to make the sale. That's where I come in. I'm there to tell you what works and what doesn't, from a man's perspective.

I have been doing this for decades, accompanying women of all ages through malls and boutique districts, giving that much needed man's point of view, with a discerning eye that has worked in fashion, photography, and film. I am not a personal shopper, I am a shopping buddy, your style consultant there to help you look your best, give an honest opinion, and perhaps even save you money - because you know you have clothes in your closet with the tags still on that you will never, ever wear.

My rate is $125 an hour, and I will be that patient shopping friend you've been looking for.

Bonus - Relationship advice from that coveted guy's perspective is included.

If interested, please email your contact information, shopping plans; when and where, and send a photo of yourself in the mirror with the words "Shopping buddy" written on your hand for verification.

Thank you for your interest, and good shopping to you.

text:

I'd want to meet new folks out and about but lately it's been pretty difficult for some reason. What the hell is it with people being so into themselves ey? Maybe it's just be but that is what I see. So I thought that I would give this a go even though I've tried making mates thru digital means only to end in weird failure. Flaky folks seemed to be the theme of the people I've chatted with. I'm happy yet sad, you wouldn't know when the sad is about so don't worry if you think I'm a downer as I'm not. Rebel yet mellow, dark with light. Hiking, travel, listening to music (everything almost, from jazz and classical to the 70s, 80s and 90s punk. World tunes to electronica, indie, alternative, classic and modern rock etc etc blah blah) and creating it (love mixing eletronica and absolutely hate calling is EDM). I create electronica and love playing me didge, and piano. Vehicle related things as I'm a petrol head, being nostalgic, sitting on roofs, looking for E.T.s, chatting on about space, snow/skateboarding, reading, filming and photographing the world, helping folks and driving around listening to indie and going into your own world. Been a night owl lately so it can be a bit lonely. I'm looking for a good friend, easy as that, proud as punch. Not a friend on short term basis either. A friend for the ages. A GOOD MATE. Can't be to difficult to find that? I dunno perhaps it can.... Age range of friends is a pretty broad one. I know good people that I'm proud as punch to call mates ranging from 18 to 80s. If you're looking for a good friend as well, sit on a roof somewhere and just look at the view, talk and be proper mates, then please, send me a reply. Does not matter if you are tall short square round black white gay straight etc etc etc. Love ya all! I PREFER to chat thru kik, whatsapp, text or actual phone conversation and not so much email.. Ta!

title: Are you lonely, looking for a friend, or need some assistance?
text:
Do you ever find yourself lonely, bored, needing help with starting basic tasks/chores, some simple motivation, assistance with finishing or getting projects started, want someone to watch TV shows with, or accompany you to the movies, go hiking, have breakfast/lunch/dinners with, or simply just being there for you as a friend?

Then look no further, I am that ideal person you have been searching for, here to help you fill the void in your life.

I can be there for you as a friend, listen to your problems, help you shop, style you, give you motivation, assist you with challenging tasks, give you clarity, exercise with you, help you with meals (and dieting), give you advice, help boost your self-esteem, organize your goals and schedules. . .pretty much anything. But most of all, I will be there for you as a friend.

I also specialize in helping people with special issues, such as: addiction (have worked as sober companion), depression, and anxiety.

I have privately helped a roster of clients throughout the years. Ranging from discrete elite, to middle-class individuals - all walks of life. Each person I have worked with has been unique in their own way, but one thing they all had in common was their positive feedback they shared with me, about how I was such a supportive encouragement in their lives. Many have said I helped them survive their darkest times, and have left them with a new outlook on life. Whether it was only a few months or several years, my friendship to them helped encourage them and brought positive change to their lives.

I am a young guy, in my late 20's, living near the West Hollywood area. I have degrees in psychology and counseling, with years of experience working with a wide variety of individuals.
I am very chill/laid-back, easy to talk to, thoughtful, empathetic, compassionate, and considerate person. I take great joy/fulfillment in helping others, by being a genuine friend. I know life is tough, and sometimes it may seem like no one is really there to care or help, but I am. It is my goal to make your life easier, help you smile/laugh, give you entertainment, something to look forward to, but most importantly, to be your friend. I am also great with pets too.

If I sound like someone that could be of help to you, please contact me and we will set up a meeting. My rates are very affordable, but can vary. I typically charge around $25 an hour, but under certain circumstances, adjustments can be made. 

I look forward to helping you!

title: Like Motorcycles? Seeking Petite/Tiny Lady to Ride With Me!
text:
I'm a mature, divorced, intelligent man, very experienced and safe rider, and I miss having a lady friend to hop on the back and go off on fun rides through the canyons, up the coast, etc. with me. My preference is for a very tiny/petite gal, around 100 lbs. Age isn't important, but be intelligent, funloving and with a zest for life!

I have a very comfortable motorcycle and a pair of matching full-coverage helmets with bluetooth intercoms so we can actually chat while cruising through the beautiful scenery! I even have a small BLJ (black leather jacket) you can use!

This is not for romance or sex, but for friendship and a companion on rides coming up this spring. Hey--if we hit it off and something "more" happens, all the better! But no expectations. Just riding, dining at hidden little roadside cafés, etc.

I will answer all genuine replies. Please write an intelligent email, tell me about yourself a bit and send a pic or two. Please put "LET'S RIDE!" in the subject line.

~ Dave

title: Some intellectuals/artists/philos looking for friends, seeking change.
text:
What's up guys, I'm creating this post in hopes of connecting with some other like-minded individuals (or maybe not, if you want to debate with someone with differing perspectives i'm down) that are interested in general intellectual progressivism, but specifically participate in or are interested in the fields of or related to: Atheism, Anti-Theism, Anarchism, Anarcho-Syndicalism, Altruism/Selflessness, Existentialism, Existential Nihilism, Philosophy, Veganism, Human Rights, Animal Rights, (Actual) Feminism, Pacifism, Ecologism, Anti-Establishment/Corporatism/Capitalism, basic equality, and generally changing the way we see things... 
These are the main causes I can think of off the top of my head, so really people who are open-minded, kind, displeased with popular American/national outlook and sociopolitical norms, displeased with current political state, and interested in seeking truth and the best answers through reasoning and rational thinking.
People with philosophical ideas based in rationale and possibly pursuing writing on these subjects.
People that are focused in socialism, communism, Marxism and other forms of government and economic policy i'd like to talk to too. Especially cool if you have or plan on taking direct action to combat problems.

Not sure if craigslist is really the place to look for people like this lol, but it seems the only other places would be punk concerts and universities, which are both easily hit or miss situations... And vegan restaurants too would work. I guess.
I'm also interested in art: 2d, sculpture, music, film, street art, tagging. My favorite music genres are sludgecore, crust punk, powerviolence, anarcho-punk, doom metal, conscious and hardcore hip-hop, reggae, soul, indie and a lot more, genres related to these I probably like. Pretty depressed music and movies are my favorites: City of God, Gummo, Kids, gang movies. Emotional, meaningful art of all kinds I'd likely enjoy.

As of now I want to establish a base so maybe in the future, friendships, possibly art collectives, housing co-ops, or other stuff can bud from this... I honestly don't know... 
So, if you're interested in any of these things, hit me up at my cell, texting's cool but if you can't I'll probably answer a call. We could talk over text or online or meet in person. I live in the 562 area but I can probably travel. If you email me put CRAIGSLIST in the Subject please, my email is oversaturated with notifications.
show contact info

(I'll link my FB to people interested)
You don't eally have to be into any of these though of you feel we could still be cool. These really just set a preliminary barrier.

If you think any of these things are cool, don't hesitate to hit me up.

title: I ain't nobody's bargain
text:
If you're reading this, perhaps the nature of the title drew you in. I will be upfront in that I'm not looking for anything other than genuine connection. Why I'm posting here, I can't exactly say. Maybe a bit optimistic? Maybe a bit crazy? Yeah, perhaps just the right amount of both.

I'm in my early 30s, and while I'm generally quite content and satisfied and (insert whatever bullshit positive-sounding adjective you want), I'm very much a restless soul at heart, but I keep that well hidden, I believe. I've had my ups, perhaps more than most, and I've had my downs, and quite frankly, I have no desire to reach out just for the sake of reaching out. I have zero interest in games and fluff. 

The more I type, the less inclined I am to to drone on and on. I feel like if you're even mildly interested to converse further at this point, you'll shoot me an email and we'll go from there. I'm no open book by any means, but what I am is genuine and fully disclosing to those who earn my trust. To get at least the tip of the inevitable superficialities outta the way, yes, I am active and do take care of myself (but yeah, of course the semi-regular porkout happens, more often than I'll admit in such a generic post, ya nosy bastard), so it'll probably be beneficial if you're of a somewhat similar ilk. No, I don't give a rat's ass about your race or age, as far as assigning "value."

Hope to hear from you if you're intrigued enough to start meaningful dialogue. Because ultimately, what the hell else is life even about?

title: Hollywood Co-Ed Basketball League for 21+
text:
What's up?

I'm the league operator for WAKA Co-Ed basketball league for 21+. All skill levels are welcome to join.

We are just entering our second season and I cannot express how sweet it's going to be! 

It's a great way to meet new people, because we are all looking to make friends and connections.

title: Woman Seeking Others Who Had LASIK on Eyes
text:
Hi. Please read all of this ad before replying. I know this is an unusual ad. I'm a lesbian woman seeking friends. But I'm looking for others who have had LASIK or other similar types of eye surgeries. I have had both LASIK and PRK. My life went downhill since I had the surgeries many years ago. I find that I connect more with people who've had similar eye surgeries, so that's why I'm looking for this specific thing. You don't have to be someone who is unhappy with your LASIK results. I just find that I connect better with people who've had these eye procedures. Due to my eye issues, I don't drive. So I'd like to find someone who I can hang out with, go places with on the bus or Metrolink, like trying different restaurants, museums, amusement parks, gay bars. I live on my own and would also be nice to have a friend who could sometimes help when I have something heavy to lift at home. Although that doesn't happen too often.
A little about myself: I'm in my early 40s. I am more butch looking. I have short hair. I don't dye my hair or wear much make-up. I am half Mexican. I suffered some minor burns to the skin on my face a few years ago. But I don't look like I was burned, I just look like I"m a little older than my age. I mention this cause I'm insecure about it. I'm more of a shy person. I usually let the other person do most of the talking. I grew up attending religious private schools in the San Gabriel Valley. I love animals. I like to collect movies on VHS tape. I am very liberal in terms of my political views. I rarely drink and I don't smoke. It's OK if you drink or smoke, as long as you don't smoke around me.
What I'm looking for is a friend who is preferably between the ages of 37 and 47. Someone who is kind and non-judgmental. I don't like people who cuss a lot or people who are violent. You would have to be a guy who is OK with us just being friends, being I am gay. (To any perverts, please don't think that I will be into doing a threesome with you and another woman. I won't do that.) If you'd like to go with me to a gay bar that would be cool. That would be cool if you were also gay, but that's not a requirement. 
If you'd like to respond, please email me and I'll get back to you soon. Thanks!

title: Email penpals
text: I'm seeking a long-term email penpal with whom I can exchange at least one long email with once a day, sharing our innermost thoughts, feelings, ambitions, and desires. Sometimes we just need to talk and we have no one to talk to- well, let's be that person for each other. Everybody's lives are so unique and complicated and distinctly important to them- let's appreciate the lives of others, and entangle our lives together by the simple, therapeutic act of writing to each other. About me: I'm a college student studying in a science-related field who's suffered from social anxiety and depression on and off. Sometimes I find myself (like now) studying late at night, or early in the morning, and feeling really alone in this huge world. Each day is different, yet the same- I only feel truly happy when I notice life's simple and beautiful things, like a little hummingbird flying out of the lush green bushes or the deafening roar of thunder in the rare storm. Maybe our correspondence can be, in a sense, one of those simple and beautiful things.

title: Looking for nice Asian girl to see a movie with this week
text:
Hi how are all of you?
I hate going to the movies by myself. It sucks, and I really love the movies, so without anyone to talk to movies about, I find myself rather lonely and not enjoying them so much.
Okay, that was kind of depressing, so let me start over.
I am looking to just hang out as friends with a nice Asian girl and who would not mind to go see the movie Olympus Has Fallen with me. I know, it's a mindless man movie, but sometimes you just need to watch something that has zero importance and forget about reality for awhile. So if you would be interested in this, let me know and we can set it up for this week. Monday would be nice perhaps?
Oh, why Asian, you ask? No, I don't have yellow fever or a weird Asian fetish (gross to both those things!). I lived and worked in Asia for several years and most of my friends are Asian, so it's just a comfort thing for me at this point. Just am more in tune with Asian culture than others and I'd like to keep it that way. Make sense? I hope so. 

About me: Blond hair, blue eyes, I hope you won't think I'm ugly. I'm in my early 30's, college educated, run several businesses, and am an author and app maker. I do a LOT of different things in my life. When we get together, I don't care if you are married, dating, single, or whatever, because this honestly is just about friendship. I mean, sure, it would be nice to meet somebody, start off platonic, and be more later down the road, but that's so far removed from my thinking for a million reasons that you honestly have nothing to worry about with me. I'm just looking for great company.

So if you want an easygoing, polite and respectful white guy to go watch a silly movie with, message me and tell me about yourself. Maybe send a pic but it's not necessary because this isn't about how you look. I'm 5'7, so maybe if you are 6'2 that would matter, because then it would look like I'm your kid or something lol. But if you are Asian, you probably are either my size or more likely, shorter, so I guess that won't be a problem to be scene in public with each other in that regard. Not that I even care I guess, but you might?

Sorry, tangent. So yeah, message me and we'll go from there. If you are particularly awesome when we meet, the movie is my treat. And we should definitely get together before the movie to just break the ice and sit someplace and talk. Sound good? Hope to hear from somebody tonight or tomorrow!

title: Looking for a hiking partner, maybe open to more
text:
I know this is a long shot, but honest abe didn't succeed in his first shot either.

I met this girl via craigslist. she had replied to a posting I had posted in casual encounters about me performing oral sex on her. We exchanged pictures, and sort of hit it off. We didn't end up meeting, but we talked, texted, and made intentions of being friends...Turned out she was a very outdoorsy kind of girl...like literally hiking everyday... as couple days transpired, she always talked about us getting together, hanging out, going hiking, and doing things together. However, "things" kept coming up, and she kind of ended up just blowing me off and shooting down the plans we would make.... It got to the point where she just ghosted me completely. This happened a couple of weeks ago... but I just haven't been able to shake this from my psyche.

It's not the fact we didn't hook up, but she projected herself as this sweet person, to only act and behave counterpoint to what she was portraying...I think that bothered me the most.

This weird experience created a couple of desires and unfulfilled wants in my mind. Where I am hoping that maybe...just maybe there is somebody out there...

That already goes hiking, or wants to --- but doesn't have a buddy to go hiking with --- or that their hiking buddy no longer really goes hiking with them. If we hit it off, I would be open to a more deeper and intimate connection.... if it doesn't pan out, at least we tried.

I would also like this moment to disclose that I am physically handicapped as well. As circumstances would have it, i was born without an arm, and leg, but I don't let that impair my mobility and enthusiasm for being an active person. I write this tidbit, so if you do decide to reply, you know about this going in, and aren't surprised later and feel I might have deceived you or this isn't what you wanted.

about me: fairly well educated, masculine guy, hairy with facial hair that i keep groomed/trimmed. deep voice, i'm about 6'1 feet tall and about 180 pounds. I enjoy a fine craft beer from time to time. 4:20 friendly, but its not a compulsory must...i don't want it to be the focal point of this post. No drugs, no stds, clean bill of health. Currently I am single, dating, but haven't quite met someone I can synergyze well with.

text:

I have some hypnosis techniques that I'd like to refine. We'd start with an online hypnosis induction through a video I've created. So you'd start privately at home.

If you're interested, please meet the following criteria:

Age 18-28, gender or sexual preference is unimportant, windows computer with stereo headphones (speakers won't cut it), and an ability to focus well, and above all that you're genuinely interested in hypnosis and not a skeptic.

Tell me your age (real age please), gender, whether you've been hypnotized or caught sleepwalking before, and have an open mind. Put "Hypnotize me!" in your subject line so I know you can follow English written instructions.

title: Having trouble finding new friends in Hollywood
text:
In my fourth year in LA I decided to move to Hollywood to try it out, but did not realize how infrequently I would see my friends in Santa Monica! I do fine socially after an introduction, but my social phobia is bad enough that I cannot just go meet people at bars or on the street. PhD in neurosciences seems to do that to people...makes us a little socially weird maybe? I wish I was better at it, but Craigslist has apartments, cars, exercise equipment, why not friends?

I would love to have a few friends close by to grab the occasional coffee or cocktail, roll our eyes at the tourists, or do goofy tourist events around for fun. I did the no-pants subway ride OMG that was hilarious. 

No idea who reads these, but I have had roommates from all walks of life and get along with most people well enough. Faster friends might be more curious about the world, geeks, maybe a little weird too, and value being kind to others. I am huge into running and lift at LA fitness too if those happen to be of interest, but they don't need to be. I also would love to start going to this Tuesday 9PM fire spinning thing near by...maybe you would do a class there?

I have enough of a media issue that I prefer not to post a picture of publicly. I'm not famous by any stretch, but I'll explain in person. Let's just say I have a very weird job!

title: Successful writer/producer guy looking to meet smart, attractive gal
text:
I am a successful television writer/producer that lives and works in Los Angeles. Really.

And while that may sound good, working in the entertainment business comes with its setbacks. Long hours. An unpredictable schedule. And not many opportunities to meet new people, namely because socializing with the people I work with is a no-no.

So, that means finding a companion to go out and do things with is often not easy.

Right now, I'm hoping to meet someone fun, intelligent and attractive who can be a great activity partner. If more develops, cool. If not, that's okay too.

Here are some of the things I like to do: Attend live theater, concerts, film, and sporting events, travel, check out new restaurants, visit museums, and do various other activities, some related to the industry.

So, if you work in the biz, or at least have an interest in things regarding entertainment, that would be great. I am pretty well-versed in popular culture (film, music, theater), and if you aren't, you should be open to learning more from a great teacher. Or turning me on to new cool stuff, too.

One last thing: Even though I work in the business, but I'm not obsessed with it. I'm easily able to turn off my cell phone during a movie, concert or a show, and you should be too.

Now some details about me: I'm a single, never married, Caucasian male, that's 6' tall, about 185 pounds, clean-shaven, dark brown hair, deep blue eyes, 40-ish. I'm fit, well-toned, intelligent, able to converse on a wide variety of subjects, down to earth, casual and quick-witted.

About you: I'm open to meeting a woman of any race. It's all good. However, I'm most likely to be drawn to someone in their 20s or early 30s, on petite side, dark hair, thin, fit, in-shape.

We'll get along if you are independent, up on current events, able to make conversation, fun, and adventurous enough to be outgoing and try new things, but not necessarily a raging extrovert. Cool, quiet and demure works too.

And you should have a great sense of humor. At least good enough to be able to tell when I'm cracking wise, and laugh at the appropriate times.

Emails with pictures go to the head of the line.

title: Seeking sanity, banter, fun, adventure
text:
Well not in any particular order actually, and yes I get I am posting on CL of all places.

I would like in free moments to have some fun and adventures in the real world, and welcome anyone with similar interests to maybe come along in your free moments too? I am single, would always be open to more if it develops, but have found most people seem to think everything is some sort of commitment instead of just enjoying the fun and adventurous moments. I choose to seek and enjoy any moment I can with positive people, as time is precious and hoping maybe can reach activity partners here.

Other times I have deadlines and commitments, and sometimes for hours into days, and I end up unwinding reading the CL posts for the great laugh out loud posts I seek. Sure sometimes I get educated, searching for the needle in the haystack or diamond in the rough.... but come on... we are mostly reading for the fabulous entertainment value at our fingertips right?

So I seek some sanity, some witty or intelligent banter, so I can make it through sometimes some very stressful moments. I have a brain, I have wit, and I know how to use it.

Am I going to send you to some site to sign up, or am I a guy...... No. It is just little ol' me on the other end of the screen. I am a white HWP 5' 8" female, and from birth too! So no need to worry or ask.

So if anyone has some free moments to share, let me know. You are here reading anyway right? While many are not adventurous enough to post, are you adventurous enough to respond? Hmmmmm....

title: A Peaceful Warrior
text:
My greatest gift of all is my ability to love a person so very deeply. I am talking about a kind of love that exists on all levels, beyond earthly emotions. I've realized that there aren't many people that will ever be able to feel or understand it. But(!) I know that you are out there. You've got to be, because I can't be the only one. Maybe not here on CL, but somewhere here on Earth.

My heart feels like as if it were a never ending ferocity, glowing inside of me and always telling me the sometimes illogical truth whether I want it or not. And I just can't help that I find discussions about existential ideas a lot more interesting than talking about people or events.

I appreciate aesthetic beauty in all its forms. But what really turns me on are things like kindness, courage, and intelligence(and not competence): attributes which I can see as clear as anything else but not with the physical eye. I am often alone but I never feel lonely. I've studied philosophy, but I'm not wise because of that. I speak different languages but my silence is louder than my words. 

These are things I've realized about myself in my time on this planet. Perhaps you feel the same way, or have realizations of your own. I keep the hope alive that somewhere out there is someone willing to say "hi" and take a chance.

text:
I am a 48-year-old, 6ft, 150lb., straight, white male, who grew up in a Jewish household, but without my father in the picture, and without being part of or subject to a lot what is involved in raising a Jewish child, i.e. without a Tanakh in the household.

Over the years, I have found the fact of not having a father around has been a tremendous void, and is one that I am now seeking to fill.

Specifically, what I am looking for are weekly sessions, for however long that day that they would take, which would feature three parts:

1. TANAKH (GENERALLY WEEKLY TORAH & HAFTORAH PORTIONS) - We would read both in advance (I would read in English, as I only made it through 4 years of Hebrew school), and we would discuss the meanings, and specifically, the values that can be derived from each.

2. PERSONAL, FATHERLY ADVICE - I would present to you one to three issues that I have been having in my life, and you would provide your best fatherly advice on those issues, drawing on your life experience, Jewish law, or whatever other source you can bring to bear. I grew up without getting a lot of critical input that my father wasn't around to provide, so I am trying to make up for that.

3. DISCIPLINE - POTCH IN TUCHUS - Proverbs 10:17 provides that "He who follows discipline shows the way to life, but he who ignores reproof leads astray."--JPS Hebrew English Tanakh, 1999. 

In this phase of our meetings, I would present an issue or behavior which I have committed, for which I feel that I should be disciplined by my father. (I grew up without my father, and those that raised me chose not to spank me when I needed it, but many years ago, as a teen, or earlier, I recognized it would have been the right way to go for me, and would have helped me a great deal.)

Accordingly, after identifying the matter, I would present you with a razor strop, for your use; you, in turn, would tell me how many swats you thought I deserved, and if it was over 25, we would split it into sets. I would take that from you, face down on a bed, stripped to a jockstrap, and the hugs and comforting that would follow afterword, as you show your parental love for me . 

I know this type of accountability would have made a difference then, as I believe my real father would have done it to me, had he lived and stuck around to raise me -- and will now, with you serving in loco parentis. He was a proud Korean War vet, and must have been a tough guy, who would have commanded my unconditional respect fron a strap if it came to that.

Accordingly, if you are a Jewish male, age 48 on up, and are a traditional, old-school Jewish father figure or father, or believe you can fill that role on an ongoing basis, either once a week or once every two weeks, in sessions, please write with your age, stats, general location, experience, and your ability to host the sessions.

I know this is quite a lot to ask of one person, but if you feel you fit this bill, write me as I've requested above.

title: Words of encouragement
text:
Recently I realized I want a career in law enforcement... :) Its so discouraging when I have friends or current co-workers ask about what I want in the future, I tell them that I'm working on getting into shape to go to the police academy and if I'm not getting a dirty look, I get a one word responses, or how much they hate this or hate that. I think it's pretty sad to see so many young people not even encouraging others who want to better a community they've been apart of their whole life, to make their world or maybe even their future kid's community a more safe place. Instead I get backlash.



I feel like I should just keep it a secret, but at the same time I'm so proud of myself for getting this far, getting over the intimidation of all the what ifs and working towards something so great. 



I guest I'm just looking for like minded people or a few words of encouragement, its always nice to read some supporting words while I'm working hard towards something so big.

title: Seeking Interesting Company

Hi,

I'm 28, Caucasian, tattooed, fit and healthy. I don't do drugs, smoke, drink. If you smoke 420 it's not an issue unless it's common. I like balance in an environment.

It's dangerous on craigslist doing this, and lots of people have told me I'm really crazy or they feel bad for me. I like what I'm doing and I'm very, very happy.

title: A plea for the rich and the wealthy
text:
If you are in the position to easily change someone else's life by giving them a bit of what you have (that you aren't using, that isn't going to change your daily life whether you give it away or not), I ask that you kindly consider giving money to this young individual.

My goal is to acquire two million dollars. I have no interest in selling a product, being part of any business deals, or being invested in. I'm looking only for people willing to give and want nothing in return. 

I'm not asking for pity nor am I trying to emotionally guilt anyone. There's no obligation of any kind to give me anything. I'm simply throwing this out there to see if anyone would answer my plea. After all, it doesn't hurt to ask, does it? I, like everyone else, am in need of financial assistance, and not the kind that loans provide. Loans do nothing but enslave people. 

I seek a gift the way a young person would ask their elder family members, except it happens that I don't have anyone of that kind in my family or social circle. One day if I do become financially successful, I would like to be that individual in the family who gives to everyone else, though.

I'm not asking for money because I am poor nor am I asking because I am sick. I'm asking because I like to take risks and I like what Lady Luck has to offer me. 

I am employed and I have a college degree. I'm intelligent and I don't have mental health issues. I'm just trying to get ahead in life in our debt-ridden society which sells you the lie that if you work your hardest and do your best you will get places. The cold hard truth is that money is wealth and wealth is power. That being said, money runs the world and money will get you places. 

While I have little interest in power, I am interested in financial freedom, so please think of your gift as buying a slave their freedom. 

Thank you for your time in reading this. I know time is money and its precious.
-Anon

text:
Hi,
I'm looking for a life long friend, and someone who can be like family to me. It's something that's important to me. We all need emotional support and others to be able to lean on. After I get to know you of course. Please know that this is for platonic only. 

Some of my interests: I LOVE my video games!!!! 😋🎮 I love drawing and Art. I like walking to places, exercising, listening to a talk show, listening to music, reading, learning new things, cooking and baking GREAT food, and watching TV shows. 

Some music of my interests are: Punk, Alternative, Rock, Grunge, Metal, some Rap, and others. Most of the music I like is from the 70s-2005, because most new music now a days is crap. 

I believe that common interests help a foundation for friendships. So we have much to talk about. Knowing our childhood interests help us to reminisce over the past. A few things that I loved as a child are Sonic The Hedgehog cartoons and of course video game, Mario cartoon and Video game, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Batman, and SEVERAL other cartoons. I read RL Stien books and watched the Goosebumps show as a kid. I really loved it as a kid. I watched a lot of movies and shows as a child. I as well loved reading comics. Many aspects of me haven't changed. I still love my video games and watching some cartoons and Anime. But we are adults, and I deal with the crappy responsibilities as well of course. 

In case your wondering of my console platforms: I have an Xbox One, PS3 and PS4, Wii (Waiting for the NX ), PSVita, 3DS, and Steam. I'm usually on my Xbox One in the evening.

title: We were friends once, lets be friends again
text:
You're the one I have been looking for, you heard my call in that place called, "the collective consciousness in that space where time doesn't exist," we existed before we were. I can't wait to close my eyes so I can see you again and take you into my arms. Your age is the last thing I worry about; your looks are seen by those that don't look with their hearts. How is it that I see you as only I could, will you see me too or will you see me with your eyes only.

We all have the ability to love many times over just as deep, just as meaningful and just as the very first time. Don't let your heart harden just because its broken and in pieces, if you do how in the world will you meet the next love of your life? When my heart is broken by someone I pick up the pieces and use my tears to glue it back together. This will not stop me from search for you, I know you will probably break it again but that will never stop me from wanting you, time and time again.

This body is older, my hair has some grey and my mind remain in my teen's, where I first saw you sitting alone on a bench waiting for the bus. You boarded, my heart stopped, my breath quickened and my stomach felt as if millions of bee's inside were stinging me. Will you write back and tell me you that you were looking for me too. 

I don't care if your taken in this life time, just let me be a part of your life, if only minutes at a time or behind closed doors.

title: A message for women..
text:
Let me tell you about real men, not immature little boys you know or think you love...

A man that can really love you is a man that will not only tell you, but show you. A man that would love to spend time with you to hear about your day. A man that would love to be the one you think about, and when you do, you get butterflies. A man that when he thinks of you, you make him feel like he can fly. A man who thinks that you are gods gift, not because you are beautiful, but because god created all woman as the most amazing creatures on earth! When I think about the perfect woman for me, I think about your sexy smile and those gorgeous eyes he gave you, so I can get lost in them when we talk face to face. When I think of you, I get butterflies myself, anxious to see you. When I think about you my heart races and I get a cool-aid smile from ear to ear. When I think of you, I'm, not like every other guy that just wants to get between your legs, I want to get in your head. A real man knows that if you seduce a girls mind, her body will follow. And that's when the best sex will come, because she's into it. A real man knows that a woman should be respected, not because his mother instilled those values in him, but because she deserves nothing less. A real man wants to hold you tightly and kiss you gently. Kisses on the forehead, and on your cheeks and loves to whisper sweet nothings in your ear, not because she wants to hear it, but because you bring it out of him. A real man knows its the little things that count, like a random text saying, " just wanted to let you know that im thinking about you, and cant wait to see you or talk to you later", or every morning text her, " I hope you have a good day! " A real man will open doors, and walk with you hand in hand, because you make him feel like he can and will protect you, because you are his princess or queen. A real man will compromise with you, because he wants to make you happy, and in doing so, you will want o make your man happy and compromise with him. A real man know, being with you shouldn't take a lot of work, being with you is simple if he pays attention to what you are saying, and respects you as the gentle creature god made you to be. He knows that you aren't like him at all and he wants to learn what makes you tick. Why you do the things you do. A real man knows that men think in practical ways and women think with their hearts, and sometimes because of that, it gets her in trouble. A real man never stops trying to show a woman how much she means to him, ever! A real man will be your strength when you need someone to be there for you in your time of need, and never judge you or belittle you because you may have made a mistake. A real man will be there to wipe away your tears when you feel like you are going crazy or breaking apart. A real man knows, that he is nothing without you, and everything because of you. A real man knows that without you, he is only half the man he can be, and Only with you, he is whole...

Lastly, I will leave you with this. Its a short poem I came across about 2 years ago and ill never forget it. As a matter of fact, I've memorized it, so I can tell it to my princess as she grows up ( Yes, I'm a single daddy ) ....

" The woman came out of a man's rib, not from his feet to be walked on, and not from his head to be superior, but from his side to be equal, Under the arm to be protected, and next to the heart to be loved "

title: great group to join if you write and want to connect
text:
If you're a writer, you know that when a specific moment engulfs you -- you just have to get the thoughts out of your head. For some of us, it's moments of sadness or loneliness, or the pain is so great that you have no choice but to write about it. I've been there ever since I was 12 so I know how it is. At least for me I couldn't go a day without writing. The pain was too deep and writing was my outlet. For the last 5 years or so I stopped writing. I decided I just didn't want to anymore and believe it or not, there wasn't ONE thing that compelled me to write. I played the piano a bit but writing was gone. . ..Until. . .My health was threatened. The possibility of breast cancer entered my life like from out of nowhere. I had to take a bunch of tests but I ended up OK. While this was happening I had to sit at the Thanksgiving table and act like life as usual when for me it wasn't. Then, my son fell after kicking a soccer ball and got really hurt. I don't want to get into all of that but basically like dominoes one thing after another has happened and keeps on happening. What do you think I started doing? Write. I haven't written as much as I would have because of my extenuating circumstances but I started to write again.

Writing heals, we all know this. Sometimes it's not about our pain -- it's constructed into a short story or something like that.

Being 45 I thought this group, would be great for those around my age. We'll have more in common, I think. But again, it's not a "pre requisite".

I created a Yahoo Group called "Writing Heals" and it would be great if you would join and give it a chance. I mean, what's the worst that can happen? Maybe you can meet some other people who are going through similar situations and this group could be about healing.

The only thing I don't want to do is LIMIT the type of writing share in this group. It could be any genre. I know for me, as a distraction, I dabble in some erotica. Maybe you did too. 

If you have any interest, 

email me at scarletblack0307 @ yahoo . com and I will send you the link to join. 

It would be an honor to get to know you.

Scarlet

title: Who else is having a lazy Sunday?
text:
've posted here before but decided to take a break from it for a while.
Before you ask for a pic, I used to post a pic with my ad, but that became a problem. Too many people calling me fake and I got tired of it. So, if this ad catches your attention, message me and you'll eventually get a pic. To be honest, I am a good looking guy. In shape, athletic. Just so ya know. You shallow motherfuckers out there.

I'm back and got some down time today. I figured I'd post an ad on this site full of crazies because, well, I just love to be entertained by all those different types of personalities LA has to offer. I love meeting new people but not murderers or clowns, so if you are one...then...yeah. I don't mean like ignorant people, I mean like literally clowns. With the big nose and paint on their face ya know? Clowns are scary as ****. Just tell me something random about yourself. Anything. Let me go first. 

I hate olives. With a passion. I also hate people who don't clear the time on the microwave after they're done using it. I hate when somebody says "I have to tell you something" and you know it's going to be something juicy, then they say "oh never mind". I hate when I get in bed and I'm soooo comfortable, then suddenly, someone knocks at the door. I hate when you think you were charging your phone overnight but wake up and find out you didn't connect your phone charger all the way into your phone and have to start your day with your phone at 4%. I hate when people have to constantly grab your arm while they talk to you. Never understood why people do that. I wonder if it's because people usually leave during their conversations...

But I do love more than I hate. For instance, I love animals. One day I will own a red panda. You're like wtf is a red panda? Google it, then come back here. I'm a big fan of giving people high fives. You'd be surprised at how many people have terrible accuracy when giving high fives. It's a skill. So if you write to me, your high five skills better be up to par. I love reaching into the pockets of some pants I haven't worn in a bit and finding money in them. I love chapstick even though I've lost almost every single stick of chapstick I've ever owned. If you've gone through an entire chapstick without losing it, I salute you. I love when a woman smells fruity. I love the feeling of asking someone if they have gum and they actually have some. Let's face it, nobody ever shares their gum. Assholes. I also love when I catch a song I really like on the radio at the beginning of the song instead of like the last ten seconds of it. This probably happens once out of every 10 songs I actually like on the radio, but ohhhh boy do I cherish that one time.

Another thing...

If you do decide to write to me,

- WOMEN ONLY.
- NO MEN. (I'M NOT HOMOPHOIC OR ANYTHING. I THINK MY CAT MIGHT BE GAY ACTUALLY)

- YES I'M REAL. 
- NO CREEPS.
- MUST SEND A PICTURE.

You can either write to me on...

KIK: tacosandbeersss
OR reply to my ad.

Don't be shy people and I'm actually very friendly and I smell good. Don't be a CL killer and don't try to go get me to eat some olives and we'll be just fine. Especially if you like staying in on the weekend, ordering some food and watching movies till like 3 AM.

Godspeed.

-Kai

title: Men's Therapy and Support Group-FREE
text:
We are a long term men's therapy and support group allowing others to join us. If you are serious about a current relationship; want a better relationship; future relationship or just support, you have come to the right place.

We are looking for serious minded bi-sexual and gay men 22-55 years old, who are tired of the rat race and really want to improve all types of relationships and communication. We are the only FREE therapy and support group in Southern California.

The sessions are conducted by a working licensed therapist and still FREE of charge, however you must commit to four consecutive weeks of on time attendance before becoming a member.

If you are one of the few that thinks you are worth more than what you've been getting, then try us. We meet every Tuesday at 7:00 p.m. sharp. Lateness and absences are not allowed within the four week orientation period.

If interested, please respond to this ad. If you are just curious and have not made a decision to join a group don't respond to this ad. You will need to provide your phone number and complete a phone interview. If that's scares you then this is not the group for you. 

This is a safe, discreet place and we want to keep it that way.

This is a serious offer so please do not ask if this is a sex group. We do not date each other nor do we allow couples.

If you have appropriate questions, please respond to this ad. Serious only. we do conduct a phone interviews before attending.

title: A REAL Platonic Posting: Dining, Travel, Music, Gardens
text:
Hey, This older (if a dynamic 60ish puts me in the grave, don't answer, because, wow, I'm dead in spite of the "dynamism") Anglo-Saxon beach boy thought a REAL Platonic posting would be good for a few laughs -- and might even be PRODUCTIVE -- but I won't jump to any conclusions because whatever you expect on Craigslist will probably not quite fit what your mind's eye anticipates. 

Yes, I have to start by saying a little about myself -- because you probably would like
a little information: I'm a very healthy guy, obsessively clean, a daily swimmer, 6'2", 190, non-smoker (NOT FOND OF SMOKE), a sometime gin drinker (not daily) and I can move around fairly easily in most levels of society -- although I haven't yet been
presented at the Danish Court (nor do I aspire to be)..........

I would really like to meet more people who "enjoy" or benefit from some of the following personality traits: 

1) KIND, good-natured, curious and informed a bit about the world beyond the subculture of cage fighting (although
that can be interesting for a few minutes); 

2) A player of an instrument or a reader of books (my, how much I expect from people!), a student of foreign languages, possibly a reader of The Economist 

3) A person who would not barf if invited to go to the Getty on
the hill or the classical collection at Malibu -- or possibly the Huntington Gardens -- or a pipe organ concert or the Hollywood Bowl; 

4) A person without intellectual pretensions, because I may be a lot of things, but I'm NO INTELLECTUAL and I'm sufficiently
smart to understand what I'm not; 

5) A guy who might enjoy a little travel up and down the Cali coast in search of a good hike or swim or interesting meal; 

6) And this is not, I know, a "personality trait" -- A person who is not so badly out-of-shape that he can't
climb a small hill without huffing and puffing and having a heart attack -- and I'll rapidly add that there are many, many wonderful people who are extremely interesting who have lost their physical vitality, but I'm just hoping to find someone who can also participate
in some adventures that require a fairly decent level of mobility. No, I'm not going to invite you to climb Mt. Hood in January -- primarily because it would kill me; 

7) One more request that might not meet the "personality trait" description: Are you fairly presentable in public? Yes, yes, yes --
I know that makes me small and takes me out of the running for being a saint, but my gosh, when the person you're with is getting furtive glances of disapproval or people are fleeing the room -- well, it's just not comfortable -- and I'll be the first to admit that King Kong had many admirable
qualities -- who could be nicer to Faye Raye? -- but green goatees and 14th Century minstrel costumes are sometimes just out of place.................

8) PLEASE -- If you're older an have accumulated some money, have some homes, have lived in a palace, have had the attention of servants and dined with princes -- Well, kiddo', that's great -- great FOR YOU -- but it's meaningless to me. I may have grown up with certain privileges (wow, you mean that doesn't enhance your life? (!!) -- but come on, don't think your "great past life" has one thing to do with enjoying the future with new friends. It's TOTALLY irrelevant to me and to almost anyone else with a solid sixth-grade education! I find that a happy, intelligent, kind person who has grown up in a shack can be as delightful as a companion as any crusty old self-satisfied fart who has enjoyed the dubious pleasure of the most exclusive enclaves in The Hamptons. It's true. So wealth, lack of wealth -- and anything it may suggest -- just may be the least of considerations as far as I'm concerned.
I don't think where I've lived or gone to school or traveled will make one little bit of difference to anyone who is seeking good companionship. Got it? I hope so -- because it's important. 

And because I have always felt that bright and friendly people of all ages beyond the most formative have something to offer,
I'm quite open to great companionship from anyone who is, let's say, thirty to ninety (or an emotionally mature person in his twenties) -- Just because I'm not intellectual does not mean I'm a fool -- and I'd certainly rather spend some hours with a joyous and informed seventy year old than a surly, self-centered dude of thirty -- and it works in both directions,
of course. 

Some old farts are intolerable bores and hypercritical. Some seem to think they've totally mastered all knowledge and are ready to tell everyone else exactly how to live. That's both boring -- and intolerable. Some younger people who are accumulating and polishing professional and social skills are delightful, even though they might not possess much more of a storehouse of knowledge than a humble fellow like me. I don't suggest people under thirty aren't great -- but why would I want to bore you senseless with conversation about foreign affairs or language or classical (ugh!) music? Really, I'm too considerate for that. Of course, there are those who are twenty-one and run circles around me musically, linguistically -- and in about every other sense. So I'll leave the stereotypes behind.

I'll mention that I'm not rich and certainly not grubbing around for money -- oh, sorry, Bill Gates says I'm poor. I'm not a tightwad, never have been (maybe that personality trait is seen as desirable by some, but I say, spend a little -- you ain't takin' it with you). It's the older guys who watch every penny that drive me crazy -- come on, go to a nice restaurant, travel to Europe once a year, fix your place up, drive a nice car -- don't leave it all to your ungrateful niece! And as far as younger people who are starting out, well, yes, they need a little help and should be a little more careful....(What was all that about: Just wanted you to know I'm realistic.) 

Anyway, it would be nice if you had a car or lived in the Long Beach-Seal Beach-San Pedro area --- a long drive around this metro area is a nightmare, as you know. If you don't have a car and have access to something like the Blue Line, that's always convenient - and I do go out of my way to be helpful.

Well, I've probably said enough to guarantee that I receive not even one response, but it's been a great exercise in typing! Thanks for reading....... Having gotten through this, you're now primed to begin reading every article in Wikipedia................ Again, my sincere thanks -- and also my sincere assurance that my somewhat irreverent tone should offend nobody........ I just find it hard to be too serious unless circumstances call for it -- and CL should be a joyous place!

title: Chat with me! But not if you're an evil snail..then nah it's cool.
text:
I've posted here before but decided to take a break from it for a while.
Before you ask for a pic, I used to post a pic with my ad, but that became a problem. Too many people calling me fake and I got tired of it. So, if this ad catches your attention, message me and you'll eventually get a pic. To be honest, I am a good looking guy. In shape, athletic. Just so ya know. You shallow motherfuckers out there.

I'm back and got some down time today. I figured I'd post an ad on this site full of crazies because, well, I just love to be entertained by all those different types of personalities LA has to offer. I love meeting new people but not murderers or clowns, so if you are one...then...yeah. I don't mean like ignorant people, I mean like literally clowns. With the big nose and paint on their face ya know? Clowns are scary as ****. Just tell me something random about yourself. Anything. Let me go first. 

I hate olives. With a passion. I also hate people who don't clear the time on the microwave after they're done using it. I hate when somebody says "I have to tell you something" and you know it's going to be something juicy, then they say "oh never mind". I hate when I get in bed and I'm soooo comfortable, then suddenly, someone knocks at the door. I hate when you think you were charging your phone overnight but wake up and find out you didn't connect your phone charger all the way into your phone and have to start your day with your phone at 4%. I hate when people have to constantly grab your arm while they talk to you. Never understood why people do that. I wonder if it's because people usually leave during their conversations...

But I do love more than I hate. For instance, I love animals. One day I will own a red panda. You're like wtf is a red panda? Google it, then come back here. I'm a big fan of giving people high fives. You'd be surprised at how many people have terrible accuracy when giving high fives. It's a skill. So if you write to me, your high five skills better be up to par. I love reaching into the pockets of some pants I haven't worn in a bit and finding money in them. I love chapstick even though I've lost almost every single stick of chapstick I've ever owned. If you've gone through an entire chapstick without losing it, I salute you. I love when a woman smells fruity. I love the feeling of asking someone if they have gum and they actually have some. Let's face it, nobody ever shares their gum. Assholes. I also love when I catch a song I really like on the radio at the beginning of the song instead of like the last ten seconds of it. This probably happens once out of every 10 songs I actually like on the radio, but ohhhh boy do I cherish that one time.

Another thing...

If you do decide to write to me,

- WOMEN ONLY.
- NO MEN. (I'M NOT HOMOPHOIC OR ANYTHING. I THINK MY CAT MIGHT BE GAY ACTUALLY)

- YES I'M REAL. 
- NO CREEPS.
- SEND A PICTURE.

You can either write to me on...

KIK: tacosandbeersss
OR reply to my ad.

Don't be shy people and I'm actually very friendly and I smell good. Don't be a CL killer and don't try to go get me to eat some olives and we'll be just fine. Especially if you like staying in on the weekend, ordering some food and watching movies till like 3 AM.

Godspeed.

-Kai

So, if this ad catches your attention, message me and you'll eventually get a pic. To be honest, I am a good looking guy. In shape, athletic. Just so ya know. You shallow motherfuckers out there.

I'm back and got some down time today. I figured I'd post an ad on this site full of crazies because, well, I just love to be entertained by all those different types of personalities LA has to offer. I love meeting new people but not murderers or clowns, so if you are one...then...yeah. I don't mean like ignorant people, I mean like literally clowns. With the big nose and paint on their face ya know? Clowns are scary as ****. Just tell me something random about yourself. Anything. Let me go first. 

I hate olives. With a passion. I also hate people who don't clear the time on the microwave after they're done using it. I hate when somebody says "I have to tell you something" and you know it's going to be something juicy, then they say "oh never mind". I hate when I get in bed and I'm soooo comfortable, then suddenly, someone knocks at the door. I hate when you think you were charging your phone overnight but wake up and find out you didn't connect your phone charger all the way into your phone and have to start your day with your phone at 4%. I hate when people have to constantly grab your arm while they talk to you. Never understood why people do that. I wonder if it's because people usually leave during their conversations...

But I do love more than I hate. For instance, I love animals. One day I will own a red panda. You're like wtf is a red panda? Google it, then come back here. I'm a big fan of giving people high fives. You'd be surprised at how many people have terrible accuracy when giving high fives. It's a skill. I love chapstick even though I've lost almost every single stick of chapstick I've ever owned. If you've gone through an entire chapstick without losing it, I salute you. I love when a woman smells fruity. I love the feeling of asking someone if they have gum and they actually have some. Let's face it, nobody ever shares their gum. Assholes. I also love when I catch a song I really like on the radio at the beginning of the song instead of like the last ten seconds of it. This probably happens once out of every 10 songs I actually like on the radio, but ohhhh boy do I cherish that one time.

title: Please give me two million dollars
text:
Imagine you are walking by on a busy city street and you see a person in need. They make their need clear and through obvious means, but they aren't bothering anyone.

You are in the position to easily change their life by giving them a bit of what you have, that you aren't using, that isn't going to change your daily life whether you give it away or not. Regardless of how much work you've put in, you aren't going to miss it, since it isn't doing anything sitting in the bank or in a stockpile somewhere.

You aren't giving to them because they are sick or have some kind of defect or because they are poor. This is above that. There's no pity or emotion. This is about giving because you are in the position to do so, and because you can. Nothing more.

You have the power to make a difference in this person's life. The small action of slipping some money into this person's hand has the potential to change their life - a check for an inconsequential amount to you, but possibly more than a lifetime's worth for them. 

By doing so you would leave it to fate to see what happens, with no regrets. This act of kindness (or a gamble as some may see it) would just be between you and the One upstairs. 

Who knows - you may see this person again someday, but it's more likely they will fade into the background never to be heard from again. But you can rest easy knowing you've done a good deed and given someone a chance - an opportunity that you know you would have taken if it had ever happened to you. You would be giving back to the universe as it has given to you.

Regardless of your decision, you will walk on and continue with your life. This is just another day, and life is good. The person before you will continue to be in need. 

The act of giving would make a world of difference and change someone's life. It is in your power. You can turn the wheels of fate. Regardless of what anyone says about possibilities and chances, anything can happen, as long there is a will and action is taken. The rest is all about choice. Nothing changes if nothing changes. Nothing happens if nothing happens.

title: Gamer? Start a MOBA team, Paragon/Overwatch, Pokemon/chat about games?
text:
Hey, I'm making this post to see if there are any chill gamers who are looking to start a serious MOBA team or just talk about and play video games together! I've been playing the last couple organized tests for Paragon and now am in the Early Access and even though some MOBAs have deeper variety in moves/item builds, aside from the great graphics, I think the 3D movement and jumping/height playing a huge factor into gameplay actually makes it really unique with a lot of new potential! I've also played Overwatch in an early test and Blizzard usually does things solid even with the Activision merge, I've played a good bit of Heroes of Storm and think that's a fun one too, but from what I've played I think Overwatch has the edge over Battleborn for FPS/MOBA hybrids, even if it's a little similar to Team Fortress 2 in ways...but that's another one I want to get serious at lol, and already I've been rambling about a lot so you sorta get where I'm at!

Anyways, I'm down to chat about games and stuff and the connecting universes (cartoons/anime/sci fi) but I'm a fairly serious gamer so I'm really looking for people to practice with and/or form a MOBA team for ranked stuff and maybe even tournaments. If Paragon or Overwatch really interests you, or you're already playing in Early Access and want someone to team with, I'm definitely aiming to focus on those the most but I grew up on original dota and warcraft 3 so I'd be open to jumping back into dota2 if you play a bit, or Smite on PS4 I could probably play for fun every now and then. Also huge Pokemon fan and really excited for Sun/Moon, and actually gonna try and excel at Pokken Tournament too if you're interested in that too - I'm a bit better than a casual at Smash but nothing amazing lol, but Pokken I really wanna try to get good at for sure. 

So yah age is open and race or shit shouldn't matter so whatever you look like or are is ok with me as long as you are really interested in these games and gaming in general too! Have PS4/Wii U/3DS Steam on a Macbook and really aiming to play a MOBA on PS4 and core Nintendo stuff on Wii U, but I know Paragon has crossplay with PC and I assume Overwatch will too so that's fine with me if you only game on PC but are serious about one/both these games. If you'd like to know more about me I'm 22 and tall and skinny and mixed race, generally upbeat and goofy kinda guy but serious about the stuff important to me and trying to make the world a better more loving and connected place and all that jazz, and if it's not your thing no biggie but definitely 420 friendly if that can add to the mix.


Finally, this part will probably scare away anyone who managed to get this far lol, but my girlfriend and I have been trying to find a chill fun young woman to both have some sexy time with. She's fairly older than me and Bi, curvy white MILF type, and not really good at video games at all lol (but tries in certain things for me), but she's super sweet and smart as hell and sexy thick and if you're a sane clean woman who thinks it might be really awesome to have fun with a couple, we can definitely talk about that, with the gaming stuff or just separately if you happened to find this and are only interested in that lol. And if you're not interested in this part at all but totally want to game together and chat, completely disregard this and say nothing about it and I'll never mention it or make it weird if you won't!

Yes this post is real just gonna add that, don't know how anyone would think this isn't. March Madness just started and Yale won for like the first time ever.

title: conversations to elicit connectedness
text:
The title pretty much sums up what I'm looking for at the moment. Someone to talk to...share moments with...wins and losses. Obviously, much of this will be dependent upon the connection achieved via communication. I'm all about connection - in all areas of life. However, I find myself working a lot lately and I am craving those really great conversations. 

If you enjoy reading and learning, we will likely get along. If you enjoy pushing your own limits and don't recognize the word "can't" in your vocabulary, we'll probably hit it off pretty well. If you can teach me something new and interesting (and are willing and open to learn from others), we 'll most likely have a good time. If you can look at life and not be jaded by the media, politics, religion (basically have an open mind), we'll get along just fine. Outside of getting along...I guess that's where chemistry comes into play. 

As for me... I am currently separated and in the process of divorce. I'm not really looking for a relationship. I have no expectations of this post other than to possibly make a new friend. But, I also believe it is important to keep an open mind, so while I am keeping expectations to a minimum, I am also open to possibilities - whatever those might be. I don't care about age, race, height/weight. None of that matters, really.

If you are at all interested in knowing more, please respond. Priority will be given to those whose responses have some substance. 

Looking forward to some great conversations!

title: Sober, beautiful, intelligent artist seeks buyer for art, friend
text:
Hi there.

I humbly write this posting. I will be quite straightforward about what I am seeking.

I am looking for someone who values or appreciates art, or who can use some of my other skills to help me to get back on my feet. It would be nice if this person might also become a friend, and that we could cultivate trust and understanding.

About me:

I am a beautiful person inside and out, very talented, and I make beautiful art and music. I have always been very driven in pursuing my dreams and have run my own small businesses. For the last 2 years however, life just changed. Finally, I came to understand that I was suffering from PTSD. I was suffering a lot and I didn't recognize myself. I spiraled downwards into a crippling depression. I was looking for help everywhere, and as you may know, it can be very hard to find support and affordable therapy for anything related to health, especially mental health. But the good news is, I did find some answers and some awesome therapy. But it didn't come cheap.

I guess this is how the cycle goes. I am doing therapy and feeling greatly restored, but I am diligently trying to hold onto my peace. I took loans to pay for my therapy, as I was desperate - and now those loans are due to the tune of $5g. Yep, I should not have gone to a loan shark. Desperation can make you do stupid things.

I am starting my life over again. I am sober and well and getting my pep back. I spent the last 6 months painting for my own meditation. My work is beautiful. I am looking for an art lover/appreciator who could buy my art and help me get back on my feet. I can also do commissions. Other skills I can offer are interior painting and decorating. I am a great decorator with great taste. Another skill I can offer is styling. I used to have a make-over for men business - again I have great taste and am great at dressing men.

I am beautiful, fun, funny, smart and a great person to hang out with. I have had an incredible life with great stories to share and I'm a very good listener.

Maybe there is someone out there who has the means and interest to have a mutually supportive friendship with me.

Please write to me for photos of me and my art if you are interested. And please only respond if you are serious. I am a real person and I have been through a lot. It takes faith for me to do this.

Peace and gratitude~

title: Genuine friendship is a blessing. Im looking for my best friend.. 😊 - w4
text:
Hi, 
I'm posting this in hopes of finding a best friend or more than one best friend. If anything, if I get one good friend from this, I'm a blessed person and I am grateful. I'm looking for a person who is serious about wanting a friendship. Who wants it a lot like me, and is willing to put in effort. As I am. Like any relationship, it takes effort, takes some of your time, emotions invested, heart, your support, your respect, loyalty, and you. No one sane can expect relationships of any kind to just happen and be there always without those traits. It's impossible and just not how life works. I know this, and can give it to someone who feels the same way as well. If you don't agree, then we aren't a good match. I need and want friends who get it like me.. Who is serious for a friendship. My life has been stressful for a long time, and lately I can't handle it very well. Having support helps. 😊Someone who cares about what I'm going through as I would care as well about what you're going through... I'd like to at some point soon hang out after getting to know you some. Getting out, and talking to someone in person is a healthy way to escape stress. It's also more comforting to be near the person who cares to hear what you have to say... I don't lie, don't disrespect, and I expect the same from you as well please.... I hope that there's a level of respect and understanding for each other's feelings. I don't want my feelings hurt please. As I hope that you'll be like family to me some day. Well, I thank you for taking the time to read this. I appreciate it, and appreciate you for doing so. I hope that you're having a good day my friend. Take care. 🙂✨

Ps. Please realize this is for Platonic only. There's a different section for something more..

title: Therapy Group for Lesbian Women
text:
Group therapy is an effective, powerful way to learn more about yourself and to achieve personal growth. Interpersonal group process can provide a sense of belonging, and an opportunity to connect with others and develop intimacy.

It can offer some relief for depression and anxiety, and be a safe place to explore and process self-esteem, shame, internalized homophobia, dating/relationships, sex/intimacy, coming out, and much more. 

This group will be run by a lesbian female therapist. All members of the group agree to honor confidentiality. This will be an open-ended group, where members can work at their own pace and leave when their particular needs or goals have been met. 

If you are ready to explore connection, intimacy, authenticity and personal growth, please be in touch.

There is a low fee per session. The group will meet Wednesdays from 7PM-8:30PM starting April 6th in Los Alamitos. If you're ready to make a change, please reply, and I will get back to you within 24 hours. I will answer any of your questions/concerns, and we can arrange an intake interview.

title: Personal Trainer
text:
Hi, I'm Eugene a nationally certified through ISSA (International Sports Sciences Association) Personal Fitness Trainer who has worked in the fitness industry for several successful years.

Are you constantly worn out and not sure what to do? What are your goals; do you lack expertise developing your fitness goals? How do you want to look and feel? And what's holding you back from getting healthy and fit? Whether you're looking to lose weight, change your lifestyle, or simply increase your overall fitness, I can help you reach your Goals! 

I'll create Custom Workout Programs to match your fitness level and schedule with your goals we develop together. I will stay on top of your training sessions and give you tips on healthy eating. I'll be with you every step of the way holding you accountable to your plan. Your goals are my goals and we will achieve them together to a newer Better You.

I am a committed, caring trainer who strives to empower individuals to a healthier lifestyle. I will work within the Core values I have set to ensure that everyone I train will move closer to becoming the person they want to become and achieve the goals they want to achieve.

Changing your mind, body & soul with the right kind of positive outlook, nutrition and fitness lifestyle will have you Feeling and Looking Good Again.


I highly recommend at least two sessions a week in order to see results. Workout sessions are designed around your schedule, fitness goals and health needs. If you're limited on time, I recommend 30 min circuit training sessions. I have Affordable Rates and New Client Specials. 

I am available to train in-home, outdoors and for private gym training with two locations in San Pedro and Torrance.

Contact me for your initial consultation and you'll be on your way to a Healthier, Positive New You in an amazing short period of time.


I'm Fully insured, CPR & First Aid Certified

I provide:

•	Initial Assessments, Measurements, BMI, BF%

•	Nutritional Guidance
•	Strength Training
•	Strength & Conditioning
•	Toning
•	Weight Loss

If you are interested in my personal training services, please feel free to e-mail me with your contact information and I will be sure to respond as soon as possible.
