title: Because. . .
text:
...at some point, you realize it would be nice to share the company of a woman. For conversation. For perspective. For the chance to get out of yourself, and to hear someone else's thoughts and feelings.

Because the act of reaching out is a necessary first step in any endeavor. 

Because to continue to do the same things while expecting a different result is insanity defined.

So if you're single, age-appropriate (I'll let you decide what that is), and interested in meeting a gentleman in his fifties, who's in excellent physical, mental and spiritual health, perhaps you might want to respond. I ask that you be articulate, in-shape, and understand the value of basic human interaction. I have posted here in strictly platonic not because I have no interest in sex (quite the contrary), but because that is something I have no interest in rushing into. If I can't speak with you or don't find it enjoyable, how great can the sex be?

Send a picture along, if you're comfortable doing so. If not, just send a thought on what I am suggesting. Why?

Just because.

title: Recovering addict seeking support and encouragement
text:
Hello--

I'm pretty sure there aren't many posts like this. I'm not looking for any kind of dependent relationship. I hate clingy people and I am definitely not one of those.

But I am reaching out without any real expectation of results. I am recovering from heroin addiction. I am in the entertainment industry and value discretion above all things.

As I have began the journey of recovery it's been really eye-opening how people I thought were friends--both addicts and non-users--have dropped contact with me. I can understand in part their reasons, but still for someone like myself, who has always loved and accepted people unconditionally, I feel a deep sense of abandonment and I am running out of places and people to whom I can turn.

I am not a 12-step person so I don't do those groups. I have had some benefit from my participation in some non-12-step settings.

If I were to express what I'm looking for it could be: (1) as simple as the time someone wrote me a brief note of encouragement, (2) someone willing to engage in occasional, limited contact support via text, email or other electronic means of communication, or (3) perhaps there is someone out there willing to engage me in a limited, no commitment role of support at first, yet willing to explore a deeper and more intimate degree of emotional support (within mutually agreed upon boundaries) after a solid degree of trust and confidence has been established.

All replies and communication will be kept in the strictest confidence and the expectation is you will likewise honor my privacy and confidentiality.

Submit replies via CL. Replies that are respectful and cast no aspersions or judgments are welcome. Anything that does not reflect a tone that is positive and constructive--or is in any way detrimental to the process of my recovery--will be discarded without acknowledgment.

title: Want a baby?
text:
So it turns out guys have biological clocks, too, and mine has been ticking louder and louder. Thing is, I don't know anybody looking to settle down and start a family right now-ish, so maybe that's not the way to go about it for me. So, I've had a few ideas for how to have a kid without necessarily following the traditional rules:

1. Ships in the night. Under this idea, we would only have to hang out long enough to get the job done. I'd sign all the papers up front saying I'd never try to find you (and vice versa), you raise the kid free of interference, and I rest easy knowing at least I did my part to pass my genes into the next generation.

2. Co-Parents. Under this idea, we become friends and work on making the baby from the outset with the understanding that nothing else has to happen. We will not plan on being anything more than two friends who have a kid together and both participate in raising him or her.

3. Fairy-tale ending. This would obviously be super, but not necessarily the most realistic. Under this plan, we try the whole whirlwind romance thing while simultaneously working on making a baby, and try our darnedest to live happily ever after.

Obviously, I've got a little bit of a sense of humor about all of this, but I'm very serious about wanting to try out having a kid. So, if any of these ideas appeal to you, drop me a note.

About me: single, white, professional male, hwp, brown hair/eyes, healthy, history of long lived ancestors and no serious illnesses. I'm reasonably open to who I might do this with, but please be healthy enough to have and care for a child, not heavily overweight, and not into drugs or alcohol.

title: Some thoughts.
text: I wake up to a dread sense of loneliness and a sense of isolation, I wander down dark and lonely mental roads. I wonder if the voices in the back of my head would shut up and leave me alone. I want to cry, but cannot, though I feel such unbearable sadness, I remember how my mother would beat me as a child and tell me crying was unmasculine. Its funny the way childhood conditioning affects us as adults, like the way you cannot chase away ghost because they ultimately live in memory. One cannot exercise memory, so in that way one can say free will is a lie. We react ultimately out of the negative parts of ourselves, our own psyches work against us in dark alley ways of the minds. A conspiracy of ego, id and superego. Or which ever way the mind works: it's a Freudian model of human consciousness now discredited by modern psychology but still pertinent to modern American pop-culture, and perhaps both at odds with and congruous to Christian religions: because of the Father, The Son and The Holy Ghost, both being modeled off a Platonic model of human consciousness. But it leaves the question can mankind truly understand itself or is it like a glove, you cannot understand the interior surface of a glove while you are wearing it, once a glove is off understanding the interior works over the human hand is a lie. There are no perfect gloves. The feeling of the hands is lost, or warmth of its interior is lost in the attempt to understand the concept of glove, therefore our reality is an illusion, we are ghost inside a bad movie, only there is no Neo to save us.

title: Cool people:artists, intellectuals, philosophers seeking homies/change
text:
What's up guys, I'm creating this post in hopes of connecting with some other like-minded individuals (or maybe not, if you want to debate with someone with differing perspectives i'm down) that are interested in general intellectual progressivism, but specifically participate in or are interested in the fields of or related to: Atheism, Anti-Theism, Anarchism, Anarcho-Syndicalism, Altruism/Selflessness, Existentialism, Existential Nihilism, Philosophy, Veganism, Human Rights, Animal Rights, Feminism, Pacifism, Ecologism, Anti-Establishment/Corporatism/Capitalism, basic equality, and generally changing the way we see things... 
These are the main causes I can think of off the top of my head, so really people who are open-minded, kind, displeased with popular American/national outlook and sociopolitical norms, displeased with current political state, and interested in seeking truth and the best answers through reasoning and rational thinking.
People with philosophical ideas based in rationale and possibly pursuing writing on these subjects.
People that are focused in socialism, communism, Marxism and other forms of government and economic policy i'd like to talk to too. Especially cool if you have or plan on taking direct action to combat problems.

Not sure if craigslist is really the place to look for people like this lol, but it seems the only other places would be punk concerts and universities, which are both easily hit or miss situations... And vegan restaurants too would work. I guess.
I'm also interested in art: 2d, sculpture, music, film, street art, tagging. My favorite music genres are sludgecore, crust punk, powerviolence, anarcho-punk, doom metal, conscious and hardcore hip-hop, reggae, soul, indie and a lot more, genres related to these I probably like. Pretty depressed music and movies are my favorites: City of God, Gummo, Kids, gang movies. Emotional, meaningful art of all kinds I'd likely enjoy.

As of now I want to establish a base so maybe in the future, friendships, possibly art collectives, housing co-ops, or other stuff can bud from this... I honestly don't know... 
So, if you're interested in any of these things, hit me up at my cell, texting's cool but if you can't I'll probably answer a call. We could talk over text or online or meet in person. I live in the 562 area but I can probably travel. If you email me put CRAIGSLIST in the Subject please, my email is oversaturated with notifications.
show contact info

(I'll link my FB to people interested)
You don't really have to be into any of these though of you feel we could still be cool. These really just set a preliminary idea.

If you think any of these things are cool, don't hesitate to hit me up.
Also, if you've got a minute plan, please email me instead of texting, I know them shits are expensive.

title: ***Live-In Caregiver/Driver/Companion/Aide Available***
text:
I am seeking a live-in position for elderly man or woman (or couple). I am a 48 year old female, single, no children. I'm educated, healthy, and strong. I'm also very easy to get along with, fun, energetic, and reliable. I'm a U.S. born citizen, speak fluent English, and possess excellent written and verbal skills. I have a valid driver's license, excellent driving record, and my own vehicle. I also have some medical training, as I went to nursing school, but quit due to breast cancer diagnosis and treatment. After I finished treatment, I no longer wanted to pursue a career in the medical field. I can explain that in more detail later, if you're interested. I can cook healthy meals, shop for groceries and supplies, drive to appointments and events, as well as take care of pets, and do light housekeeping.

Immediately after my treatment, I became a professional makeup artist and photographer, and owned my own business for the next 12 years (I also did this type of work while in school, along with my caregiver/companion/aide duties). I ran that business until 3 months ago, and due to the loss of my lease, I lost the building and the business. I have been a live-in caregiver and aide ever since. I am currently working with a large family near Palm Springs, and I am not happy here (I don't like being so far away from my neighborhood). We have an informal agreement, and I can leave anytime. I am very anxious to find another family/couple/single in my normal neighborhood, which is Toluca Lake (I lived in Toluca Lake for 17 years, and I miss it terribly). I will not consider any other neighborhoods besides Toluca Lake or Burbank.

During my schooling, I worked as a part-time caregiver for an elderly gentleman who was disabled. I worked for him for a few years until he passed away from complications of his paralysis. My duties included dressing him, lifting him into his chair, aiding in the restroom, bathing, and lots of driving. I did some cooking and cleaning, but mostly accompanying him to his family and social events. I was also responsible for getting him to and from his home on Catalina Island. He also had a very large home in Bel Air/Palisades, and I had my own private quarters although I did not live there full-time. 

Although I am not a licensed nurse or aide, I am still an excellent caregiver and companion. I can oversee/administer medication, maintain basic health and hygiene, and provide companionship, meals, and rides to and from errands. I have a lot of experience with the needs of seniors, and I am an excellent listener and friend. I love art/museums, music, and classic film. I am the perfect solution for someone who does not need a full-time nurse, but instead just needs someone to look after their daily needs, and keep them company. 

I do have a cat, and I am a smoker (who's genuinely trying to quit), but I will not ever smoke in anyone's home. I am a private person and keep to myself, unless I am asked to be present as part of my duties. I wake very early, and I am a very hard worker, and absolutely am NOT lazy. title: ARE YOU 60+ & WANTING TO CUDDLE?
text:
Let's try this again. When I ran a similar ad recently I got answers from women in their 40s and 50s who thought I was looking for a mistress. I am not.

I am an old man, in good shape, hwp. I have been widowed for many years after a long marriage. I am not looking for love much less for a wife or live-in companion (or mistress). What I am seeking is a sensual, friendly relationship with an age-appropriate woman. I crave physical contact - hugs, strokes, cuddling. This is not the same as looking for sex. Whether it goes in that direction would only be by mutual choice and after some time.

The essence of the relationship I seek is a mutual desire for warm, comforting physical contact. Whether we find other interests in common, like music, movies, art, books, hiking, would remain to be seen. We might be very compatible physically and have nothing else in common. Or maybe we would. In any event, I am not offering or at this point in my life emotionally capable of being in a marriage-like arrangement so if that is your long-term goal I am not your man.

You should be at least 60 years old. Please do not answer this ad if you are younger! There is no upper age limit as long as you are in touch with your physical need for human contact. I have no restrictions as to your race or ethnicity. (I am white.) Within limits, I have no preferences as to your physical type. (I would draw the line at what is called SSBBW in CraigsList-ese.) The women who have been important in my life have ranged from skinny to Rubenesque; their shape has not been one of the most important things about any of them.

I live alone in downtown LA. I can host or travel. We could arrange a first meeting someplace public for coffee or a drink. I would like this to happen soon. Since I am retired I am free much of the time.

If you reply please put CONTACT as the subject to weed out CL spam and scams. If you reply I will respond with my name, photos, and phone / text #.

title: Looking for a smart, funny girl to be my FWB! :)

To start off, I've noticed that there are a lot of "bots" and "spammers" on this website, so I'd like to let you know that I'm completely real.

I'm educated, smart, well-dressed, confident but not cocky, and funny. I love watching movies and TV shows, to playing video games, to reading books, to finding the best places to eat. 

While I'm looking for a FWB, I'd love to also find someone that I don't mind "grabbing a beer with." I'm 100% not looking for a relationship, but I would prefer that we get along intellectually and that we're able to have a conversation. I'm looking for someone who's not afraid of the "friend" in FWB, someone who's down to watch a movie or grab a cup of coffee on any given day.

Physically, I'm Asian, ~5'8, and athletic. From years of swimming, I've gained broad shoulders. I love to stay physically fit, and I do work out around 4 times per week. I don't smoke or do any drugs, drink recreationally, and have no weird piercings or tattoos. 

Ideally, you are older than 18 and fun to be around! I love people who are humorous and know how and when to crack a great joke. I'm attracted to women who are smart and confident, a la "lady in the street but a freak in the bed." I'm open to any race and any race. Please practice safe sex, and be disease free!

title: Marriage or Dating in SCV...
text: not exactly your thing? I can relate-but it would be nice to have a local friend/companion for occasional daytime activity such as music, museum, art show, or lunch. For example, there is a May 1 art show at La Chene that might be fun to see-maybe w/lunch [I'll pass on the escargots though.] You could even bring an energy bar if unsure of such a heavy commitment. I took early med retirement at age 60 so I'm leaning to someone within a few decades to facilitate conversation. Be good if we're on similar page re the historical, cultural, pop references from the late sixties to now. I esp relate to former teachers, therapists, nurses anyone sharp with or without college degree. 2/3 of my degrees are from CSUN and I was a 30 yr teacher/counselor for LAUSD. Folks who favor Trump, Cruz, Rubio or other ultra-conservative GOP types pls ignore this post. I lean to Progressive even Libertarian causes/candidates-which equates to Bernie this election cycle. I supported Hillary and Obama in the past but my patience for corporations owning/running govt is long gone. Christians ok as long as you don't proselytize, recruit or pray for me. I designed and built my own [w/c friendly]home near Magic Mtn; if you're close by-near Hasley, Hillcrest, Old Rd, 5/126 pls step up to meet a new friend. I've done over a dozen marathons, countless 10 ks, won trophies/awards in tennis, road racing and other sports but I'm slowing down to pursue more sedentary events like gardening, home imp and cooking. I have a huge and diverse cookbook collection-would love to make u Fri or Sat early eve dinner. I have a foto on facebook, 812 credit score but I don't do church except on very special occasions. Love to discuss current events. politics, pop culture- just need a local friend. My relatives and best friends are gone-geographically or physically. title: Jersey Boy Exploring Burbank Today - Let's Hang Out
text:
Hey there. Or alternatively, as we say back east, "Peace." Heh. I keep mentioning my roots, but to level with you I've lived in L.A. on and off for years. I'm visiting a friend in Glendale(fyi, I'm Italian and German, not Armenian, lol). They have an impromptu accounting contract they're working on this afternoon, so that means I'm free-floating on my own for the remains of the day. 

Having had more than my fill of the Americana and Galleria over extended periods of time, I thought I'd head out here for the afternoon and see what kind of mischief I can get into. Looking for a partner in crime(getting tipsy) - you game?

And now for a few things you should know before you respond:

I'm 6'1", a former bodybuilder who suffered a rotator cuff tear a year ago, so while I haven't worked out since then and indeed am ever so slightly stocky, I still have a decidedly muscular/athletic look. I would say unless you're strictly looking for a ripped dude, I will be decent enough to look at. I myself personally prefer fuller-figured but nothing sloppy in a woman's build, very feminine and a full face of make-up absolutely. No tomboys. 

I'm a bit coarse in my NYC-esque manliness and need a delicate little flower to properly balance out my surly/brawny energy. I probably look like a jock, but as it turns out I have the intellect to go along with it, so do not be fooled by the meathead look.

In a similar vein, and in being a tried and true city boy, to be perfectly clear, I am not paying your way today. 

Why? Firstly because this is L.A. 

Secondly because it's not 1950 anymore and I don't throw money at random strangers.

As an aside, the true alpha males don't need to resort to such things in order to garner the fairer sex's company. In other words, don't be broke, be independent enough to pay your own way, and show me you are of the quality ilk I'm seeking by not being a scheming little tramp. 

Seems pretty fair and reasonable in today's sordid world I'd say. Fair that is, to everyone except the scheming little tramps out there, lol.

Straight up - let's hang out girl. I definitely am a lot of fun, not looking to go to bed, and just would dig some chill company today. You want to swoon? Do you deserve such charm and grace? If yes, I shan't disappoint.

Above all else, don't be a kid. Secondly, don't think a cute face is enough. In my unique case, it's not. My rivers run concertedly deeper. I am seeking an element much harder to find than a nice smile.

Someone humble, well-mannered, emotionally open, and without 10 walls up. In short I need a real human being. Not a typically catty prima donna L.A. clone. 

If you are true quality you will be treated like gold. My word on that. -winks-

As another aside, I am a freelance web content writer and work exclusively and full-time from my laptop. I am not a plastic, sheltered, foofy person. I am blue-collar and highly mature by nature. I don't care if you work as an executive for a corporation or at the local diner as a waitress. A person is defined by their actions, not their career. Hopefully you -get- that. Only the wiser ones truly will I'd surmise.


Anyway, I'll be out here for about the next 5 hours or so, so if you can get out here or live close and don't mind walking(smartest option, trust), text me a picture and we'll catch up with each other in just a bit somewhere in Burbank. Maybe grab a bite, get a drink, who knows. We'll play it by ear.


In closing, everything above you've just read is as accurate as humanly possible. No tricks, no games, no lies. Make sure you present yourself in a similar manner is all I really ask. Much appreciated.


See you soon, 

DOMINICK

svn three too three won ate too too nyne six

Be sure to text a picture first and foremost. Thanks.


P.S. Hispanic and Asian women don't be shy! I find you beautiful. Not interested in Afro-Americans, just an attraction thing, have many black friendz in JZ, so take not it personal. 'Tis only a preference.

title: Friends without any romantic intentions
text:
I've been trying to make a platonic friend here for a while. It isn't easy, and I think a part of the problem is that people have different interpretations of the word "platonic". That being said, I think a good way to go about actually making a truly platonic friend is to put everything up front.

To me a platonic friend has absolutely no romantic intentions at all. I want to find a friend that is just that, and only that. Just someone to hang out with and do stuff with. I want to hang out wearing my shorts and a T-shirt, find a hole in the wall joint to eat at, grab some drinks at a chill bar, maybe play some pool, catch a movie, go shopping... keep everything down to earth. As friends only. This means that there will never ever be any possibility of hooking up, dating, ect. Just like it would be if I'm hanging out with my guy friends. 

As your male platonic friend, I can look under the hood of your car and pretend to know what's wrong with it. If we really hit it off, maybe I can help you move some heavy furniture some day. But, one step at a time.

In all seriousness, I would like to meet more people to chill with. I'm really into independent movies, and by independent, I mean movies where the director as the strongest voice in telling the story. Some of my favorite directors are Paul Thomas Anderson, Alexander Payne, Alejandro Gonzales Inarritu, Richard Linklater, Ang Lee, Kubrick... I don't watch sports very much, but I do like to play tennis and snowboard. Some of my other interests include cars, the internet, and economics. I'm not into politics at all. I'm not religious, but I like a lot of eastern philosophy and believe in karma.

LA can be a difficult place to make friends. There are tons of people here, so it seems like the value of an individual diminishes in the vast pool of people who reside here. Plus, everyone is so busy and it takes forever to get anywhere. But, despite these obstacles, it's worth whatever it takes to find the right friend. Nothing in this world is worth having if there isn't someone to share it with.

I'm Asian & 40

title: are you smarter than the average reptile?
text:
im in a committed ltr, have a small circle of friends i've had since childhood, have a close and loving family, and am involved in the community... but i'm being fake with everyone... i need to find people i can really be myself with.. i'm very opinionated and driven to explore the meaning of life and such.. and those around me are satisfied with trudging through the game and being distracted with frivolous reptilian stimuli, but i love them so i act like i care about the pointless things they're interested in, act like im not disappointed with their lack of ambition, act like i love them for more than an emotional attachment. 
i want friends i can admire, who inspire me, who have challenged life and come through wiser. 
im a heathen. i do believe in a higher power... its called physics. energy and the spiritual self are very real.. but believing in a conscious entity is laughable, so i cant take believers seriously. its like a gown ass adult truly believing in the tooth fairy. its far more likely that our reality is a computer simulation.
i love animals. my passion is to better the lives of domestic pets. i aspire to be vegan, i recognize the health benefits, and im tired of wanting to cry every time i eat cheese and think of the video of the newly freed dairy cows prancing on grass for the first time in their lives. 
on the same note, i'm trying to break my food addictions... sugar, bad fats, processed foods, animal products.. 
i strongly believe in population control for many reasons. watch the 'idiocracy' intro for basic context. 
i dont use or condone the use of cosmetics of any kind. its needless exposure to toxins, needless expense, and contributes to global pollution... all for the sake of vanity (same goes for tattoos). skincare is important healthwise, but to play into a fictional standard of beauty is hindering social progress.

so yeah, those are some of the more controversial reasons why i cant be myself with those i care for the most. i can put up an act to get along, but i'm THIRSTY for intellectual company!! people who are striving to do better because they know better, even if doing better is a pain in ass. i know this isnt the best place to find that... but hey, if im on here, there might be some other jewel rolling around here too :)

title: Confirmed Bachelor Looking for a Friend
text:
I'm posting here, because what I seek fits the definition of platonic. I want to enjoy friendship, companionship, and not have sex.

This takes the pressure and expectations out of a craigslist posting. I'm not gay, impotent, or crazy. I just know the stuff that comes with intimacy and I'm not interested in dealing with the "why didn't you call" and "I think we should move in together" conversations that usually follow. Frankly, it's not worth it. I'd rather avoid the drama and emotional roller coaster that comes with dating.

If I want to have sex with a stranger, I know how to find it. This isn't my first rodeo! I want something different. Less impulsive. More permanent. 

I'd rather see a movie or grab a bite to eat with a friend than by myself. Most of my friends are married or in committed relationships. I decided to post on CL to see is anyone is open to hanging with an educated, respectful, and fun guy who wants to regularly get together, but isn't interested in dating. 

Here's my "wish list":
1. No addictions;
2. No crazy exes that will slash my tires or my throat;
3. No anger towards men (like your ex) that you will take out on me;
4. No lying from the start unless you're absolutely certain that I will never find out. If I find out later, no matter how small, I'll have trust issues. Friends don't lie to each other - except for how fabulous the dreadful haircut or outfit looks; and
5. No photos needed until we exchange a few emails. I didn't post one and I shouldn't demand one in return. That's only fair.

I didn't post age, race, height, or weight for a reason. It's not because I'm ugly. I'm not, but that's not the point. This is a platonic ad. 

Oh, and one final point. I'm happy to exchange emails with anyone who makes an effort to communicate. One liners will be read, and then deleted. Hookers, trannys, minors, and bots need not respond. No, I'm not joining a web verification site! No, I'm not looking to trade "roses" for your company. No, I'm not interested in being saved and attending Bible or Scientology classes with you.

It's really a very simple concept. Could you use another friend of the opposite gender? I could. I'm in the market. That's why I'm putting it out there. 

Please don't respond if you're looking to get married, or want to move in together and/or start a family. 

Please do respond if you're generally upbeat, you're interesting and interested, and you would rather spend time with someone from time to time than sit at home alone wondering why, in a City this large, you can't find someone who is polite, respectful, and who enhances your life. Maybe we're a match -- as friends who will enjoy spending quality time together.

Interested? You know what to do.

title: I didn't know
text:
I'm using this platform because writing to an ambiguous reader makes it easier for myself to thread these thoughts into a cohesive whole. If I were to sit down and just think about what bothers me, I would end up going off the subject. On the other hands, the expectations of these words getting to you, ambiguous reader, give me some pressure to finish.

I thought this whole growing up thing would be easier. I got to this point in my life focused on the idea that making myself a "better person" would, in turn, make interesting people gravitate towards me. That's why I learned how to play drums, or the history of western philosophy, or how to comfortable express my thoughts without any insecurities. 

I try to speak from my heart, without reservations, and I expect the same from others. But this road of making myself "better" has only granted me solitude. In the effort to find those of you who like to communicate, I have mostly seen indifference, and apathy. As if life wasn't running around us, as if we didn't have a limited time to understand all of this, as if our chances to really connect, and discover the world through the eyes of others wasn't a precious opportunity, I see how the smallest effort to be vulnerable and open is treated as a sign of weakness. I wonder if I'm the only one that feels so lonely, and if it is really accepted that everyone talks about themselves in the same way. We all like the outdoors, we all like hiking, we all would like to be in better shape, we all like to travel. What else is left to say about us?

I have tried to keep up, and be a part of the trend: Ive been casual, and Ive been vulnerable, Ive been dominant, and submissive, Ive tried countless times to see if inside the shallow shells we put on there's a sign of any intention to strive for a deeper connection, but I haven't been lucky. I will, nonetheless, keep trying to find that person who likes long letters, and random walks.

title: Something special and real
text:
I don't know if this is the right place for this post, what I'm looking for is a special friend that is looking for the same thing. There are times in your life when everything is going well, but for whatever the reason we feel melancholy and lonely. We don't have the same connection with your partner both mentally and physically anymore, but you still want to hear a kind words or compliments. Maybe share special moments and conversations, which may become endearing, captivating, adventurous and downright fun.

I want something deeper than just superficial intimacy. I want to connect on a level so few have had the privilege to achieve with that special friend. Finding someone to chat and share everyday things, talking about our life's journey and all the choices we've made good or bad. Having that person email, text or Kik message with during the day and evening whenever possible.
I don't know why certain people are put on the same path, coincidences, fate or sheer happenstance but nevertheless, I have always cared and valued everyone I have come into contact with. Are you the one this post was meant for, I sure hope you are, I know you're out there?

I relate well to all ages and have more than enough confidence in my ability to engage in great conversations with you. Age to me is just a number and another label society likes to place on us.
So take a chance and find out if I'm what is needed to help get you through a boring day. Remember we all need someone in our life's from time to time to make us feel alive. 

If age and marital status matter to you then, please don't bother, I may not be the one for you. I wish you all the best and thank you for taking the time to read my post.

title: Woman Seeks Other Christian Professionals for Friendship
text:
Hi there! :)

I'm a fit and active Christian woman looking for other Christian Women and Men for platonic friendships only. Married or Single, that's fine. Just be ready and available to actually meet in person! (If you're a man, and you're married, DO NOT CONTACT ME.) 

I don't have children, so my time is my own. What I find very challenging in this city is meeting other people who share the same values as me. I'm a follower of Christ Jesus. I'm a born-again Christian. I don't smoke/drink alcohol or use any type of drugs whatsoever. I never have and don't find it interesting at all. 

I enjoy all outdoor activities. Shopping and dining out at CLEAN hole-in-the-walls, ethnic restaurants, Asian noodle houses & vegan and vegetarian restaurants is another favorite pastime of mine. I'm open to making new friends, so if there are activities that you enjoy, I'm willing to try them, as long as it doesn't jeopardize my well-being! :D

I'm a university-educated professional who is well-read and well-spoken. I have a happy and mellow personality. I'm easy-going, as long as people are respectful and cooperative, too. :) I'm a very good listener, have a positive attitude, and I'm a loyal friend.

My pet peeves: People who are inconsiderate, don't or can't communicate, and/or are constantly late.

If you're similar to me and you're a mature person over 35 (and under 60), please feel free to get in touch. Please send me an introduction that I would appreciate, meaning, if you send me a one liner, I will not respond. There is too much spam everywhere.

*****I prefer that you're a woman, unless you're a man who can be my younger brother. I'm looking for emotionally mature people who are followers of Jesus that I can fellowship with and do fun platonic activities with.

If you're a vegan or vegetarian, that's even better! :)

Thanks for reading and God bless you. Please be ready to speak on the phone within a day or two of responding. (Hopefully, our schedules will align.) I'm interested in talking on the phone and seeing if we hit it off!! :) Then, we can make plans to meet within a week or two. Thanks! :)


Cities: Culver City, Los Angeles, West LA , West Los Angeles, Santa Monica, Miracle Mile, Century City, Beverly Hills, Marina Del Rey. Orange County is okay, too.

title: Best Friends 🙂😋
text:
Hi,
I'm looking for local friends to hang out and be actual friends with. Best friends would be even better!! Do things together, or just hang. I hope we can get to know one another first before meeting. It's awkward to meet strangers. Please be serious. Please don't reply out of urge if you don't plan on a meeting and being a friend. It's a waste of everyone's time. No couples please. If you're married it's fine with me. Who am I to judge? Though I don't plan on being someone's secret. So only reply if you can have friends, and can do friend things with me. I don't want my feelings hurt because of any drama in the relationship. I'm a very kind, genuine, and caring individual. I genuinely care for others and their feelings. I want to be there for you, as much as I hope that you'll be there for me. We need to emotionally support each other. We all need a support system in place for us for whenever we need it. Also, it's biologically our survival needs to surround ourselves with others that care about us. It's what makes us mentally healthy. Among other things. I want to keep a continuous communication going. Not, just for a week and it ends. How's that a friendship? 😁😞 I thank you for your time in reading my AD my dear friend. You're appreciated!! Take care. 😋❤️

title: ARE YOU 60+ and WANTING TO CUDDLE?
text:
Let me try this again. When I ran a similar ad recently I got answers from women in their 40s and 50s who thought I was looking for a mistress. I am not.

I am an old man, in good shape, hwp. I have been widowed for many years after a long marriage. I am not seeking love much less a wife or live-in companion (or mistress). What I am seeking is a sensual, friendly relationship with an age-appropriate woman. I crave physical contact - hugs, strokes, cuddling. This is not the same as looking to get laid. Whether it goes in that direction would only be by mutual choice and after some time.

The essence of the relationship I seek is a mutual desire for warm, comforting physical contact. Whether we find other interests in common, like music, movies, art, books, hiking, would remain to be seen. We might be very compatible physically and have nothing else in common. Or maybe we would. In any event, I am not offering or at this point in my life emotionally capable of being in a marriage-like arrangement so if that is your long-term goal I am not your man.

You should be at least 60 years old. Please do not answer this ad if you are younger! There is no upper age limit as long as you are in touch with your physical desire for human contact. I have no restrictions as to your race or ethnicity. (I am white.) Within limits, I have no preferences as to your physical type. (I would draw the line at what is called SSBBW in CraigsList-ese.) The women who have been important in my life have ranged from skinny to Rubenesque; their shape has not been one of the most important things about any of them.

I live alone in downtown LA. I can host or travel. We could arrange a first meeting someplace public for coffee or a drink. I would like this to happen soon. Since I am retired I am free much of the time.

If you reply please put CONTACT as the subject to weed out CL spam and scams. If you reply I will respond with my name, photos, and phone / text #.

.... but with attention and new changes ~details on the 'Room~mate' part haha:) , as I find myself in a situation where I need a new place to live! For 2 years I was at a a mission house in Los Angeles, basically almost for free in exchange for a lill bit of volunteer work here and there. I hope to find a similar place again (they basically sponsored me so I could work full time on an unpaid Christian ministry for those in the entertainment industry ). . .but for now maybe someone truly has need of a Bestie, and would think it cool to try livin together 4 a few months? 
Maybe between like $200- 400 to let me couch crash until I can find something that will sponsor the work that I've been doin, again:) 
Or if we can find rooms in a New place together? (I'll be looking as well to find something about in that $200-400 range for both a friend and myself... to have our own separate rooms!! I already have a few leads:) 

I do need to figure this out asap, as I've made commitments that I would move back pretty soon,.. so my response preference might be to a bff interested in rooming for a while, yet it's not dependent on such. Again, . .it would be fine if it were only for a few month, non serious with livin commitment, trial type thing! 



~~~~
okk reposting on the best friend part!
(What I'm really after most!) (grin!) 
~~~~

'Ey there! ~smile~ 

I feel like it may a bit peculiar making such a longg post, but also imagine that life isn't gunna move forward in 2015 unless I really put out 'there' what my hopes are! 


I'm really looking for a (similar aged 28-35 maybe?) lifelong best girl friend, who is really after that "1" best gal pal, in life. That one sidekick who's been at it with you through it All- from youth's endlesss adventures, to where yrs down the line ya end up rockin a senior home together (that's not meant to sound too cheesy, haha) --still w that inpartable bond and that ultimately "special " relationship... as each other's life's best friends. :) That type of thingg? :) 

I thought I had that years ago, but she ended up moving + eventually stopped carin about what we had. It's been quite a while since I've had anything with true 'depth' w another girl .. 

I'm Hopin to find someone who **like myself (It's hard admitting this, but I don't have Anyone near this really. I don't even have a Sister! LoL), who's lived in that lack & Void; **who doesn't 'all ready' have their one go-to girl, or a network of their lifelong collected bffs? 
(This almost seems rare to come across I'm findin haha)
Just someone who's a similar 'lone wolf' maybe but wants that set apart specialness and depth with another girl... and like me just hasn't been able to quite find it yet


~~~~
Also throwin this out there as an ideal situation maybee?~ I'm in the entertainment industry (pro-model on and off for years... but getting more away from that in lieu of christian volunteer work) so it would be awesome to seek out the occasional work/ or gig with a bestie as well! I may want to get into doing some promotional gigs or background tv/video work ('clean' stuff in case anyone is wondering, as this is craigslist lol) 

I also live in a really really cheap/ (near free + pretty private) place on a church's grounds if that person would be interested in bein roomates. (Not to rush such a thing though!) 

So anyway more about me and or a potential fit for a best friend, ...(one certainly doesn't have to work in entertainment, in fact I feel like I connect w those who don't just as well, see below paragraphs.. haha)~ I'm 32, but still look early to mid 20s and hope to always have a extremely free and youthful spirit!. So between 27ish-35 may be a good age range? I'm single, straight, no kids, n may not ever have them. (just don't seem to relate to that way of life as some can haha...I might adopt a pre-teen someday tho! LoL) Since I'm single I'd really like to get back into a few girls nights out either at the local or Hollywood bars/ clubs ...but I'm not in the 21 yr old go out every other night state anymore, so just not all the time :p. I'm honestly reeallly Down to Earth and well normal, Grew up in the north east a bit hippie/ punk in high school, so I'm pretty well rounded and have all these sides to me that don't necessarily go together (grin), haha. I feel like sometimes I'm a bit rare & unique in that sense! 

I like arsty people and things, music festivals, anything sooaking in nature, random one of a kind hobbies (want to get into glass ~ blowing this yr), crazie adventures, trying to make a difference in the world, etc. 
I'm more Introverted in the sense that I need a Loot of alone time (** n this would be Reeeally key if livin under the same roof haha:), 

I'm about Depth/ and quality over quantity in relationships, (I'd rather have one or two crazy deep people in my life [say the guy soulmate and female best friend], than be keeping up w a lot of superficial relationships ) etc... *But I'm a really friendly (and socially w it, lol) introvert who enjoys getting out there, meeting people and seein the beauty life inevitably has to offer!! I've always been one to hang out with any "type" of group!! 

I also tend to get along better with people who are more contemplative~ of the same personality as well (and can also appreciate those who've suffered or ave been through a lot in their lives) 


Ok so in review!! (lol.) If ya think we may be a good match, hopefully write a good amount about yourself, and let me know that ya relate to my post? I tried this before in my native state & had no idea who to reply to as so many people wrote a line or two. Maybe just let me know u're on the same wave-length about being the type to have one top bff, rather than you being a 5-10 bff type person & that you may have need of one... Oohe guess I should say this upfront! haha... I currently am w out a car, but I doo hope to get one... . But maybe someone who sees the value in my post enough for that not to deter them... title: Looking for Partner, Soulmate, Roomate
text:

title: Anyone going thru MTHFR disabling symptoms?
text:
For the non-MTHFR going "huh?", no, it's not the insult abbreviated, it's a very serious and disabling health condition; this page will answer all your questions:
http://www.stopthethyroidmadness.com/mthfr/

---------

If you are dealing with this, or are a doctor who understands what we go through, I would be interested in hearing from you. I felt this week like I was literally going insane, as I started B's therapy. Felt better at first, then it made me worse, hypersensitive to everything and flying off the handle so I quit the B's and now feel better. I thought I was going to have a heart attack as I was getting stabbing heart pain. 

I don't know how to deal with this. It has destroyed my relationships. Now middle-aged. I can no longer cope with apartment living, surrounded by loud, inconsiderate neighbors smoking is polluting my place and destroying my health further. I can't cope with noise. I need to relocate ASAP, but I can't afford my own place, and I don't know how to handle a roommate when I can't cope with background noise and I am allergic to all odoriferous environmental pollutants.

If you understand please feel free to write I would like to talk to someone who understands, or is coping with the illnesses & many symptoms, but not interested in meeting as I am completely disabled and can't really go out. Of course, platonic only. that will not change. Thank you for reading, enjoy your health if you have it, and have a great day.

title: "Life's like a movie, write your own ending..."
text:
Jim Henson wrote the quote above. I sort of adore the guys legacy, his work on the whole.

So! I don't post here often but after some consideration I figured why not? I recently got out of a pretty serious relationship and I feel a little bit lost sometimes. We are still friendly but I based a lot of my plans around the idea of "us". My career is going great but I definitely need to jump start my social life.

I have many friends all through Los Angeles and the Valley but I want to make some friends more in my immediate vicinity. I live in Koreatown, more specifically around Wilshire & Normandie. I'm looking for partners in crime and fellow urban adventurers who I could hang out with on the regular. I miss that aspect of the East Coast. Friendship immediacy.

I'm really into music, television, hiking, video games, comic books, and art. I want to travel more and see the Pacific Northwest. Stuff like that. Long conversations. Late nights. Creating art together.

So yeah... if this seems interesting then hit me up. My therapist said try looking online so this is my good faith effort. I tend to get along best with females but guys are welcome too. No bigots, flakes, or far right conservatives. I got opinions on things that tend to irk those types. A great local best friend is all I'm asking. Too much?

title: Need a Roommate/New BFF
text:

The Situation:
I'm an LA native moving back after graduating university a year early. All of my friends are still in school or otherwise unavailable so I have no one free to live with me starting this Summer. I'll have a full time job and will be able to afford a nice but modest 2-bedroom and would love to live with a cool young person (gender not important) in a similar situation. I'm hoping to start looking at places sometime this Summer and want to get to know prospective roommates before then so we can bond and know who we'll be living with before jumping in!

Please include a picture in your message! 

Little bit about me:
Non-Smoker but 420 friendly. 
Queer
Cis Woman
Latina
Speak 4 languages
Have a house-trained dog, she's less than 10 lbs and super friendly, never bitten anyone in her life. 
I'm allergic to SOME cats, if you have one it's not a deal-breaker we'll just have to figure it out. 

Housekeeping:
I'm easy going and flexible but after living with absolute slobs for the past 3 years I like to keep a clean house. However I'm not your maid so pitch in and we'll be good! Messy is cool just clean your fucking dishes within a couple days not weeks pls <3 (my current roommate doesn't seem to get that dishes don't magically disappear after the first week of them being in the sink)

Self:
I love movies, I guarantee I've seen every chick flick you can think of but I'm also obsessed with Tarantino and Robert Rodriguez. I like girl punk and indie folky shit, my music taste is all over from Sonic Youth to Kate Nash to Queen to (don't judge me) Bowling for Soup. I like drinking pink wine on my living room floor and having game nights as well as going out and listening to music or eating at diners around 1 am. I'm an anthropology major, passionate about social justice and feminism hoping to work for a labor union and eventually go to law school. We can talk about social theory and Foucault or 90s tv shows and our favorite Harry Potter DADA teachers. I've had a string of shitty roommates and I'd just really love to live with someone I could be good friends with as well. I know all the "naysayers", critics, whiners, complainers, screaming copycat etc will have a heyday with this post. All I can say is mind your own damn business and get a friggin life. I'm tryin, so should you. Anyway, that being said....Am looking for someone to travel and spend time with. JUST friends. 
NOT LOOKING FOR: 
Sex, long term, psycho, drama, baggage, gifts, life partner, loud, clingy, money grubber, smoker, alcoholic (the occassional drink is fine), drug addict, bible thumper, opinionated/argumentative, liberal, politically correct, anti-Christmas, mean, rude, or any other form of fucking nutz.

title: Looking 4 Weho Friend Who's Passionate 4 Music
text: I am 51, white and an easygoing older bear type who is looking for a friend in the neighborhood. I moved to West Hollywood last July. Most of my friends live in the Silver Lake area. I had a good friend who lived on Vista here in West Hollywood but he moved to the Westside last December. One of my other good friends just recently moved back to the suburbs. To cut a long story short, I don't have any friends who live close by. I know a lot of guys make friends at the bars, but I am not really all that much into the bar scene. Once in awhile I will go to the beer bust at the Faultline or the Eagle, but that is not something that I do very often. I also enjoy groups like Audioslave and Alice in Chains as well as groups like Dead Can Dance and This Mortal Coil in addition to some show tunes, some classical music, some opera and a fair amount of Gregorian chant. I am a graduate of Cal State Northridge. I have a BA in history with a minor in language. I have worked mainly as a legal secretary and an executive assistant, but am currently unemployed. I am also a published author. My first book was published last May and is a collaboration between me and a friend of mine who is a visual artists. If you like music too and would like to get together to talk, hang, have a conversation or maybe a cup of coffee or even a beer or a glass of wine, hit me up and we can trade pics and get to know each other. title: We all walk through hell alone
text:
Have you ever reached a point, where your mind is so crowded with thoughts, ideas, words, memories; that you start to feel alone in your own flesh? That words like "detachment" and "disconnect" do not make you comfortable. That you feel a need to connect, because deep down you know we are all searching for something, yet when we see a glimpse of it, we deny it?

Sometimes I wish I could be stupid, not have as much understanding as I do today. Not be as well versed, technical and analytical as I am. That desire would take over reason, and to just let go. I've done it and been happy, but torment myself afterwards.

I, as many of you, am searching for happiness, we know what happiness is. We know that blissful feeling of a warm embrace and of a caring word. We search for happiness in our work, hobbies, friends and relationships. Has the world gone mad? I believe it has. Because no one cares to be really happy anymore. Instead we replace happiness with things and we ignore the glimpses and swipe left, block and unfriend, just because.

My reasoning is complex, and I do not expect to be figured out. How boring would that be. I want to engage in a passionate conversation that will leave us wanting more knowledge and carefully know when to stop and lay on a park under the stars and enjoy the silence.

Please hit me with your best shot. If you read this far, our minds may have something in common.

I'm Marco.

I know, what guy needs to be talking about things, well I'm no regular guy. Conventional is probably the best word lol.

I do feel like I need to talk to new people. I don't know where to start. I'm the shyest outgoing person there is. title: Do you ever want to travel?
text:
Uhh hi, how are you? Good I hope. 
So umm, yeah okay, gotta get this started. 
The title, what I mean is do you think you can leave everything here, in cali, scratch that, in south central for a sec? Just go, get out of here, tell your family and friends that I'll be back, just gonna take a road trip. Yeah? Well I have, I want to travel, see different lands, visit historic places, laugh with different people. I love my family and enjoy my friend's company but its always the same thing. Do you feel isolated, institutionalized of the way of this life? The cali life? Do you believe that you should be free? Be the phoenix and soar? I sure as hell do. I'm sorry, I'm just rambling on and such. What I'm trying to say is: Would you like to go on an adventure with me? 

This is what I purpose: A road trip, a nation-wide road trip, going to state to state, city to city, visiting historic places and seeing new faces. Eating at amazing places like that guy from Man vs Food and taking pics while we are at it. Do crazy shit while we are young and have awesome memories to our friends and family.

Who's in charge of what: I take on the gas money and the hotel rooms we get, I pay with my own money.

title: Sick of the Generic L.A. Clones - Jersey Boy In Burbank
text:
Hey there. Or alternatively, as we say back east, "Peace." Heh. I keep mentioning my roots, but to level with you I've lived in L.A. on and off for years. I'm visiting a friend in Glendale(fyi, I'm Italian and German, not Armenian, lol). They have an impromptu accounting contract they're working on this afternoon, so that means I'm free-floating on my own for the remains of the day. 

Having had more than my fill of the Americana and Galleria over extended periods of time, I thought I'd head out here for the afternoon and see what kind of mischief I can get into. Looking for a partner in crime(getting tipsy) - you game?

And now for a few things you should know before you respond:

I'm a bit coarse in my NYC-esque manliness and need a delicate little flower to properly balance out my surly/brawny energy. I probably look like a brawler, but as it turns out I have the intellect to go along with it, so do not be fooled. I am well-versed on many an obscure topic. I am definitely not the typical, safe, Burbank conversation.

Straight up - let's hang out girl. I definitely am a lot of fun, not looking to go to bed, and just would dig some chill company today. You want to swoon? Do you truly deserve effortless charm and grace? If yes, I shan't disappoint. Just make sure you don't either. Very important.

Above all else, do -not- be a kid. Secondly, don't think a cute face is enough. In my unique case, it's not. My rivers run concertedly deeper. I am seeking an element much harder to find than a nice smile.

Someone humble, well-mannered, emotionally open, and without 10 walls up. In short I need a real human being. Not a typically catty prima donna L.A. clone. Of which there are a plethora in this coffee shop alone.

If you are true quality you will be treated like gold. My solemn word on that. 

As another aside, I am a freelance web content writer and work exclusively and full-time from my laptop. I am not a plastic, sheltered, foofy person. I am blue-collar and highly mature by nature. I don't care if you work as an executive for a corporation or at the local diner as a waitress. A person is defined by their actions, not their career. Hopefully you -get- that. Only the wiser ones truly will I'd surmise.


Anyway, I'll be out here for about the next 5 hours or so, so if you can get out here or live close and don't mind walking(smartest option, trust), text me a picture and we'll catch up with each other in just a bit somewhere in Burbank. Maybe grab a bite, get a drink, who knows. We'll play it by ear. Just don't be broke and unable to pay your tab. That's not my speed in a woman. 


In closing, everything above you've just read is as accurate as humanly possible. No tricks, no games, absolutely no lies. Make sure you present yourself in a similar manner is all I really ask. Much appreciated.


See you soon, 

DOMINICK

svn three too three won ate too too nyne six

Be sure to text a picture first and foremost. Thanks.


P.S. Hispanic and Asian women don't be shy! I find you exquisite in your exotic nature.

Mwah! 

See you soon fair lady..

title: Someone, somewhere?
text:
I'm starting all over and looking for a few gal pals to connect with. 

I've had my share of restarts. 
After college? Check! 
Career change? Check! 
Significant other cheated? Check!
Baby? Check!

It has been a wild and wonderful life but at the end of the day, I miss having some gal pals. So what happened? The usual. Friends moved away. Interests changed. In a rare case or two, I simply lost touch. 

One would think that technology has made it easier for people to connect. In theory, this would be true. In reality, it is far from correct. During my spare time, I sing with my eyes closed and the music turned up loud. Yes! That really happens. Favorite music? I'm all over the place. From Taiko drums, to the magnificent voice of China Forbes. <-- If you haven't discovered her, google her. She speaks a few different languages and her voice is like silk.

I also am a gardening enthusiast. <--Sounds granola, I know. I'm motivated by the delicious pleasure of eating something right after it has been picked from a tree or pulled from the ground. My green onions would make Hulk Hogan weep. I am kookoo crazy about NASA and all things related to SPACE. 

I have a 4 year old daughter who owns my soul. Although my daughter will never know this. I am a tough disciplinarian who doesn't believe in spanking but instead relies on Dan Siegel's "No Drama Discipline" to navigate the woes of toddler. 

I'm throwing this out there. If it doesn't work, maybe I'll find a bunch of groups to join like the dude in Fight Club. Worked for him, right? 

Age: Almost 40 and proud of it. Most people think I am an my early 30s and I am quick to correct them. Every day is a blessing, and I can only hope to live to 100. 

Ethnicity: That is an interesting one. Guess.

Looks: I can't believe this is even an issue. Attractive enough to still be asked out by men (and sometimes women) even though there is definitely a ring on this finger.

Favorite food: Hah! That is easy, potatoes. Fried, baked, in a soup? I'm there. Poutine is my favorite way of eating potatoes.

Drugs: Eh, not for me. No judging. I'm serious about living to 100. One bad trip or getting something that is laced will totally ruin that effort.

Tattoos: Definitely sexy. But not for me. I'll admire them from a distance.

Sexuality: Gay all the way. But not the in your face, flag waving, card carrying, lets go to West Hollywood type. Most people are like. Ah-ha! I thought so but was not sure.

OK, that is enough for now. If I sound interesting enough, let's connect.

title: Analog interaction
text:
Has technology made us any happier? 

Well, I can objectively say that not having to remember my friends' phone numbers has made it easier for me to fill my head with more (some times useless) information. I also have half a docen folders with backed up photos from every time my iphone runs out of memory. I can now see exactly what that night two years ago looked like, and any clouded memory I had of it is meaningless, because I don't need to depend on transient impressions anymore. But, is that objectively good?

I can't objectively say that it has made me a better person. The time that I've saved searching for information in google instead of a physical dictionary hasn't really improved the quality of my researches. As a matter of fact, I now rely more on the promptness of google than I am confident of my ability to recall something from my own memory. 

Craigslist's format suits my antiquated preferences to establish a connection with another person. It reminds me of the days when the internet was still a black box of surprises, and people needed to work on their personalities (or at least grammar) to make a good impression, rather than leaving that task to a photo. This semi-analog platform allows one to do more with less. We could infect these blank canvases with a few yellow icons and expect them to convey our mood, but I'd prefer to rely only on these sterile characters to make you, ambiguous reader, shape these sentences in the way it best suit you. I hope I've stimulated your imagination more than if I had uploaded a selfie.

Let's take advantage of this analog platform and use it accordingly: there's always facebook and instagram to upload photos. Take a chance to get to know someone without expectations. Take a moment to convey a message without addressing yourself/your qualities/your looks/your hobbies etc. Who are you underneath all that fuzz?

title: Well-written cynicism
text:
I've been an avid reader, occasional poster and extremely rare responder of the Craigslist personals for about a year now, and I've noticed some common (and hilarious) threads of interest among the women of LA. I'd like to take a minute to break it down for you, ghetto style, so you can recognize the following horrific cliches and just maybe avoid getting flagged as spam.

ReadySetGo!!!!

"Seeking a man that's at least 6 feet tall. I like to wear high heels" -- Damn, totally boned here. I'm only 5'7' or maybe 5'8′, apparently equaling "somewhere between midget and elf, and therefore undatable", even though the average American male height is 5'10. And 6 feet tall? What kind of shoes are you wearing anyway? Some shit from the lunar landing? Next. . .

"Looking for a God-fearing man" -- I get the biggest kick out of this one. Why would you be afraid of your own imaginary friend? Seems like you'd better imagine something a little less hostile. I'd suggest Papa Smurf.

"Must like the outdoors" -- Barring a select few dweebs I've met that live in their parents' basement and mainline Mountain Dew so they can play World of Warcraft for 87 hours straight, most human beings like being outside at some point. Sure, I'll go for a day hike with you. Does that mean I want to live in the woods for a month and wipe my ass with a pine cone? No thanks!

"Looking for friends first" -- Cool, I'm always down for more friends. Wait, what's that you say? Your hot friend Brittany is single? Excuse me while I ask her for her phone number.

"Must love children" -- Unlike the mighty lion (who will kill and eat cubs from rival males) I say the more kids, the better! We can open our own sweatshop and they can make you shoes. I call being the manager!

"I like having fun" -- Whew, what a relief! I'm meeting too many people these days that think having fun sucks. I'm a big fan of fun myself! We have so much in common.

"Must like to dance" -- Really? Have you ever met a straight guy that wants to go dancing? Wait, I take that back. I do know one guy, but he's from Puerto Rico or something. Come to think of it, he's probably gay. That's right, Jorge -- I've got you figured out.

"I like going out, but also enjoy staying in for a quiet night at home" -- That's great, because staying home or going out and doing something are pretty much the only two options you have.

So in conclusion, I say the luck of the Irish be with you lovely ladies of LA in your search for a badass Daniel Craig-era James Bond lookalike that will dance the Macarena with Mr. Cuddlekins the Poodle whilst purchasing you an all-expenses-paid vacation to Maui. Just keep in mind that Mr. Bond is only 5'10.

That being said, let's enjoy a scotch and make fun of people tonight. Done.

title: Self publisher seeking partner
text:
Hay there. Are you a professional/seasoned writer with a book you want to publish? Or maybe you are launching an independent publishing company on your own? Or perhaps you are a published writer who is tired of giving the lion's share of profits to your conventional publisher and you yearn to break free and start keeping your own profits since you're doing all the work anyway. Or you might have already tried self publishing and want to do it again but this time not totally alone. 

Do you long for a comrad you can go to for emotional support, feedback and friendship, who is going through the same thing with their own book? Someone you can plan marketing strategies with? Share contacts and experience, bounce wuery letters etc off? Essentially walk the path with? Who doesn't want to charge you? 

If so, we have something in common and might benefit from knowing/helping one another. I am a professional screenwriter who is on the verge of self publishing my first novel and though I have read dozens of books, articles and blogs on the what, when, where, if, how, and whys of indy publishing, it's like a big confusing blob of information at this point, and I would really like to have one comitted, serious, humble, friend with a sense of humor, in the trenches, who I could help navigate and vice versa, the choppy seas of first time self publishing. Someone who will keep me accountable but will also hold my hand when necessary. I am looking for someone who is driven, believes in themselves and their product, imagines that they could easily become a self made millionaire (I know it's rare but you know your book is amazing and needed in the world) from it, who has a strong work ethic, will not give up and flake out and has done their work. I am looking for someone in the final editing stage who will be ready to go to print by fall---just so we are on the same time table. If this sounds like you I hope you will respond. I am not looking for someone to assist me for pay, and I'm not looking for a pipe dreamer who someday wants to write a book or publish. I am calling in someone who is doing it. Please don't write me unless your are serious and this ad reads like an answer to your prayers. If you write me, be prepared to talk on the phone within 48 hours and meet soon after. Please tell me about yourself, your age, your gender, your interests, about your publishing experience, past writing you have done, any applicable jobs or experience in related fields, about your book, the title and what you have done so far on the road to publishing it. If I think we could vibe I'll respond by answering all the same questions.

title: Artist Seeks Muse
text:
Pablo Picasso once said: "Art washes away from our souls the dust of everyday life." 

Man, can I ever relate to that! I can't possibly say how many times a certain song, or book, or film, or painting has rocked my world and catapulted my limited perspective into another stratosphere.

As an artist, I draw inspiration from out of the wild blue in the most random possible ways. I assume others browse Craig's List Personals essentially to seek inspiration from perfect strangers. 

Today, I woke up inspired to reach out to other denizens of the City of Angels who share my passion for the arts. Feel free to contact me if any of the following apply: 

1. You wish to swap creative ideas with a fellow artist via email, telephone, or over coffee. 
2. You have always been passionate about the arts and curious to connect with a local artist. 
3. You wish to submit photos, or pose as a photo model for a potential painting.
4. You would like to escape the tame beige world to enjoy a more wildly colorful life.
5. Hell, you may have creative reasons to connect that this artist failed to think of.

The attached is a pic of me taken about a year ago, by a random stranger from another country, who happened to pass by while I was painting a mural on a busy boulevard in Venice California.

title: Personal Trainer Needed
text:
I'm an ex-athlete looking for a new fitness trainer. You must understand nutrition, strength training and listening to your client's needs.

I've been back in LA over a year now and I've got a demanding job, so my stress level is more elevated and I sit a lot more than usual - so I'm battling belly fat that I've never had. 

I need help with nutrition (what to eat, when - and what not to eat, when) and more frequent, heart-rate targeted cardio. I also want to tighten things back up a bit.

I'm still fit - 42, 5'10 and currently 167 (and good looking for all you shallow types, ha). Healthy lifestyle and pretty laid back, love to laugh and smile. I don't generally complain during workouts, will follow the advice given and prefer if you have a sense of humor. 

I work in Burbank but live in the West Hollywood area, so please be fairly local. 

I just joined Equinox Hollywood (opening this Fall) but I'm open to a temporary membership someplace for the next several months to get my body back in shape. I currently workout in my office building, but it's limited. 

I've had successful trainers in the past and I know how my body works. That said, I'm not afraid of hard work (or commitment) and always willing to let a new trainer show me something new.

Please get back to me with more than a phone number (a website, info, list of questions, etc). I need to know we are a good fit - hope you understand, and look forward to hearing from you!

title: 60+ & LOOKING TO CUDDLE?
text:
m4w body : fit height : 5'11" (180cm) status : widowed : Non-smoker, light drinker

age: 79
Let me try this again. When I ran a similar ad recently I got answers from women in their 40s and 50s who thought I was looking for a mistress. I am not.

I am an old man, in good shape, hwp. I have been widowed for many years after a long marriage. I am not seeking love much less a wife or live-in companion (or mistress). What I am seeking is a sensual, friendly relationship with an age-appropriate woman. I crave physical contact - hugs, strokes, cuddling. This is not the same as looking for sex. Whether it goes in that direction would only be by mutual choice and after some time.

The essence of the relationship I seek is a mutual desire for warm, comforting physical contact. Whether we find other interests in common, like music, movies, art, books, hiking, would remain to be seen. We might be very compatible physically and have nothing else in common. Or maybe we would. In any event, I am not offering or at this point in my life emotionally capable of being in a marriage-like arrangement so if that is your long-term goal I am not your man.

You should be at least 60 years old. Please do not answer this ad if you are younger! There is no upper age limit as long as you are in touch with your physical desire for human contact. I have no restrictions as to your race or ethnicity. (I am white.) Within limits, I have no preferences as to your physical type. (I would draw the line at what is called SSBBW in CraigsList-ese.) The women who have been important in my life have ranged from skinny to Rubenesque; their shape has not been one of the most important things about any of them.

I live alone in downtown LA. I can host or travel. We could arrange a first meeting someplace public for coffee or a drink. I would like this to happen soon. Since I am retired I am free much of the time.

If you reply please put CONTACT as the subject to weed out CL spam and scams. If you reply I will respond with my name, photos, and phone / text #

title: Relocating back to L.A., seeking a kind heart ... ?
text:
(I HAVE posted this in the rooms shared section as well, but just in case wanted to try it here; even if it brought me a new friend for my arrival, that would still be MORE than worth it.)

Yeah, I know: in Los Angeles, known for anything BUT kind hearts?

My situation is a bit unique, so wanted to make sure I explained it right to be upfront/honest from jump. I am a gay white male, a freelance writer (yes, published) wishing desperately to get back to the Los Angeles and pick up with pursuing writing again where I left off. I was in Seattle when, about a year ago, allowed myself to be talked into relocating to Phoenix by a "friend" who lived in nearby Scottsdale who, soon after I arrived, turned out to be anything but a friend (one of those people who, when in a relationship with someone controlling, forgets they even have friends). I truly hate it here, on top of which am in a roommate situation that's escalated to such a disaster I am moving out next week.

Problem is, I've been able to save no money to move WITH. But as I am so close, need to relocate, AND can get back at the same job I had in Koreatown when I left Los Angeles a couple years ago, I was hoping this was my shot.

So the reason I write this ...

What I am seeking is someone who might be able to help someone until he gets righted again, willing to let me start paying rent once the checks are coming in, or maybe has some personal assistant, writing, or other work I can do for them to defray costs the first month. As a writer, I can edit, help someone with their manuscript, do online research - and with a work background in administrative, call center and customer service work, with a HUGE emphasis on the phones, I have proven in the past to be very valuable in pretty much anything along these lines. Once up and running fully, was looking for a place for maybe $500-$600/month, all bills paid if possible and with something by way of furniture only because I won't be exactly bringing any. Easy access to Ktown would be a miracle, work-wise. In return, you get a roommate that doesn't smoke, is completely anti-drugs (including weed, it makes me sick to even smell it), doesn't think enough of alcohol to normally even keep it in the house, and TOTALLY respects someone else's space, place and things ... hoping for the same (though I haven't always gotten it, certainly not where I am now). I clean up after myself, do dishes soon as I've finished eating (sometimes even after I've cooked, before eating), and really believe that if everyone picks up after themselves then very little maintenance is needed, anyway. I'm a film buff, reader, and write blogs of both film and book reviews, and while I believe roommates don't have to exactly be friends, I believe they should be friendLY; be able to say hello, how was your day, maybe even sit down to an occasional meal together. Definitely a believer in open communication; how are any bumps in the road resolved, otherwise, really? Silence only makes things fester.

I know I have no right to think anyone in hardcore, hard-hearted L.A. would be open enough to respond to this - but as my mom, who passed away in 1999, impressed on me growing up: you never know until you try. Am in a bit of a desperate situation, and if you've not got a lot to lose anyway, why not go for your dream?
