title: Therapy Group for Lesbian Women
text:
Group therapy is an effective, powerful way to learn more about yourself and to achieve personal growth. Interpersonal group process can provide a sense of belonging, and an opportunity to connect with others and develop intimacy.

It can offer some relief for depression and anxiety, and be a safe place to explore and process self-esteem, shame, internalized homophobia, dating/relationships, sex/intimacy, coming out, and much more. 

This group is run by a lesbian female therapist. All members of the group agree to honor confidentiality. This is an open-ended group, where members can work at their own pace and leave when their particular needs or goals have been met. 

If you are ready to explore connection, intimacy, authenticity and personal growth, please be in touch.

There is a low fee per session. The group meets on Wednesdays from 7PM-8:30PM in Los Alamitos. If you're ready to make a change, please reply, and I will get back to you within 24 hours. I will answer any of your questions/concerns, and we can arrange an intake interview.

title: Vegetable Gardening Friend Sought
text:
Ok this will be a weird one for you gentle readers in CL-land, however, I did this back home in Chicago and have a lifelong friend from it.

Just so we are clear -- you garden, I do not. All of this will be clear as you read what I have to say.

My husband and I recently rented a charming home in the hills of Bel Air, think 16th Century cottage. With a decent sized area for a garden and hiking trails behind (as in fallow land) that is super easy to access. I would LOVE to garden and have visions of nummy home grown vegetables and fruits gracing my life. However, I am a notorious plant killer, I am serious, notorious. I once killed a bamboo garden, yes, the weed, bamboo, just by taking possession of a home. There was a crazy happy garden and then death, all within a week, I changed nothing not even the gardener, all I did was talk to the bamboo, I even said very sweet nice things. I have been killing plants since I was born, I have system tested every variant and every variable, the issue is me. We have tried gardening classes and friends have tried to help, it is no use. My husband has a to-do list that far exceeds his capacity to tend a garden, heck he bought loads of vegetables 3 weeks ago and has not had the time to even consider getting them into the ground. 

Why not get a gardener? Because fruits and vegetables and the like need love, they need someone who knows to talk to the tree fairies and the vegetable trolls and that can only really be given from someone who has a vested personal interest in those little green lives. 

My friendship, is clearly not a great trade for this work, LOL though it would be great if we become friends. So what am I offering? Beyond an unlimited supply of chicken poop, which I do not value but I am told is of value to gardening people . . . a gentle sweet gardening spot in a crazy city, a cut of whatever we harvest -- in some cases my husband wants to plant things we would never eat and wasting that food would make me sad (zucchini, squash, stuff like that). He is a bit of a prepper. So, if you have the prepper gene, I offer a refuge with some built in food if things get rough. A tranquil place to come and read or paint or whatever when you need some outdoor space. I will gladly buy the trees, plants, and seeds and necessary support items, we have auto watering, I will not touch/look at/speak with the plants though I can harvest without death ensuing. And since my death touch does not extend to fungus, as I get my mushroom garden up, I am also happy to share, my husband doesn't do morels but if there is interest I would be willing to add those as well. Oh and for digging and flattening land I will offer up my husband and his digging dog to help, smile. My husband and I are both great cooks and we are happy to feed you when you are here as well. And I am a start-up specialist so if you are wishing to start your own business I am always willing to give advice from my battle scarred playbook.

Some added data:

1) You should probably like large dogs, I have large pups and while I do NOT want them in the gardens, they are a part of my home life.

2) Yes, I have chickens, they are not producing and while I could share some eggs, and probably will if we ever get them popping out, my dogs eat raw and the hens were bought for my pups first and all us humans second. While I have threatened to feed the chickens to the dogs if I continue to have a negative ROI on them, the truth is I will rehome the lazy chickens if they are still not producing by the late spring. 

3) I work from home. 

4) While I am one who really does think fairies and trolls probably have a hand in the life and happiness of the plants, I am not an airy fairy LA girl, I am a pretty hard core Libertarian who grew up very Midwestern, with Midwestern values and goals, with New Age parents. While I tolerate 'liberal' chatter outside of my home, when we enter my Zen sanctuary, I only really let people in who share my core values. Not to say you need to vote Republican, I am about as socially liberal as it gets. It's that my values are that we are each responsible for our own well-being and should not be whiney and begging the government to wipe our butts while they take basic human rights away from us. I have very close friends who are literally European Communists, the difference is their opinion is educated and worthy of intelligent argument, where as local liberalism sounds a lot more like waaaah waaaaah waaaah. The garden is there partially for happy cooking goodness and partially to sustain us when pandemonium takes place outside, it is consistent with my values. I don't have time or ability to garden, so I am willing to trade with someone who wants to garden for items they might value. 

5) Wildlife, wildlife is an issue. We have deer, wildcats, and coyotes around and about. The chickens are safe, and I may place a dog kennel outside to further scare off the larger bullies in the neighborhood. I have heard either rats or mice as well but the dogs are great mousers and we have owls so I believe there is no reason (yet) to do anything than let nature take its course. 

6) We have too much shade but we are happy to cut back or hire people to cut back the trees.

7) I have nearly zero storage space so we need to balance the needs of the garden with where we store those garden necessities.

8) No men, I work from home, my husband does not and while I like men as friends and humans, I don't want the added stress and worry while I am busy on conference calls and the like. 

9) We are not 420 friendly. That is to say, in my bestest Libertarian voice, I don't give a damn what you ingest, smoke or lubricate your skin with and I don't care what you might do if you go for a hike, however, we will not be breaking federal laws in my home. 

10) I am a little bit crazy. We, well me really, pondered the purchase of an outdoor cat (I am badly 
allergic) and a goat. Both for utilitarian purposes and not because of a whim, we chose against both because of the bullies that also live on the hill with us and hunt by night.

If this insane post has peaked your interest, it would be delightful to chat!
